Title: Chain Disaster
EventDesc: As you and Jetavie near the end of the building, she suddenly doubles over in pain, clutching her crossed arms tightly against her chest and leaning against the wall.

Title: Chain Disaster
EventDesc: You notice a red tide ascending from your feet, accompanied by a nearby dark rift showing in the air. Suddenly, a red bow emerge from it.\n"That weapon is targeted at... Jetavie!"

Title: Chain Disaster
EventDesc: As you try to approach her, you find your body immobilized by the encroaching red tide at your feet. The red arrow penetrates through Jetavie's body, eliciting a cry of anguish from her.

Title: Chain Disaster
EventDesc: In a desperate attempt, you struggle to break free from the red tide. However, an enemy, fallen from the sky, now stands between Jetavie and yourself. To save her, you must overcome this barrier.

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: You successfully defeat the eerie enemy, reducing them to red dust that disperses into the air.

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: You quickly approach Jetavie, who appears fine but huddles in a corner, clutching her legs tightly. Her eyes lack their usual sparkle.

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: The strike just now has left a red mark on Jetavie's back.

Title: Ominous Branding
RoleContent: I'm fine. Let's... keep moving. Hurry and help me up, you dummy.
EventDesc: Jetavie covers the wound with her hand and rises to her feet with your assistance.

Title: Ominous Branding
RoleContent: The enemy took away my power... Dammit, will it all end up in the same way again?
EventDesc: Sitting on the ground, Jetavie wears a bitter smile, yet the sadness on her face remains unmistakable.

Title: Ominous Branding
RoleContent: It doesn't hurt, you dummy. Why didn't you come to save me just now? Because you couldn't move, huh? Right, I know that already. How many times has this happened...
EventDesc: Jetavie throws a punch at you, but her fist ends up landing softly on your body.

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: Some special supplies left behind by the enemies are scattered around.

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: The enemy has vanished, but the red tide still lingers.\n"This place is not safe."

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: You decide to search for a safe spot nearby and take a break with Jetavie.

Title: Ominous Branding
EventDesc: After a quick break, you and Jetavie are ready to go again.

Title: Silver Lining
EventDesc: Knowing that red tide will emerge ahead, you cautiously avoid the area and descend into the tunnel alongside Jetavie.\nUnfortunately, the enemy seems to know you well, leaving you with nowhere to conceal your thoughts.

Title: Silver Lining
EventDesc:
The dark rift materializes before your eyes again.
The red bow embodying fate is once again pointed at... Jetavie.
"This time, your feet are still free."
"This time, you will not let go of her hand!"

Title: Silver Lining
EventDesc: The red bow pierces through you, causing an excruciating pain, as if an unseen force has been torn away from your body.

Title: Silver Lining
EventDesc: As you brace yourself to reach Jetavie, an unknown enemy emerges before you. It seems to have acquired a newfound form through knowledge gathered about you, with a powerful core driving their every move.\n"Since escape is not an option, just confront it!"

Title: Flickering Light
EventDesc: The formidable foe collapses heavily onto the ground, its body reduced to ashes. The <color=#FF5826>core</color>, once the source of its terrifying power, falls to the earth, immersed in the red residue.

Title: Flickering Light
RoleContent: I remember this. It's the Access Key... I think?
EventDesc: Carefully navigating around the red residue, you retrieve the unidentified object from the enemy's core amidst the remains.

Title: Flickering Light
EventDesc: Having retrieved the supplies, you approach Jetavie. Teary-eyed, she gives you a slap before holding you close.

Title: Flickering Light
RoleContent: You idiot! Are you trying to get yourself killed? For someone like me...
EventDesc: For some reasons, Jetavie's face flushes a deep shade of red, and she begins swinging her fists aimlessly in your direction.

Title: Flickering Light
RoleContent: Of course, it's because I'm worried about you... Hey, does your wound still hurt?
EventDesc: In a rare display of gentleness, even her tone is not as aggressive as usual.

Title: Flickering Light
EventDesc: After consoling Jetavie, you obtain some special supplies nearby.

Title: Flickering Light
EventDesc: There's no remaining red tide here. This place should be safe for now.

Title: Flickering Light
EventDesc: Considering your injuries, you decide to take a quick break with Jetavie here.

Title: Flickering Light
EventDesc: With every step into the depths, the enemies grow increasingly treacherous. You decide to hasten your pace, resolute in pressing onward.

Title: Abyssal Echos
EventDesc: The red tide slowly engulfs the surrounding space, while the swirling dust paints the sky a faint shade of lavender. With no place to seek refuge, you and Jetavie realize the place you are standing on could be your final ground.

Title: Abyssal Echos
RoleContent: I told you, I'll stick with you till the very end.
EventDesc: From the churning tide, the monster takes shape.\nIt relentlessly absorbs everything around...\nJetavie reaches out, taking your trembling hand, and whispers tenderly into your ear.

Title: Abyssal Echos
EventDesc: Vaguely, you catch a glimpse of a countdown suspended in the sky.\nOn the pitch-black screen, the numbers have become frozen, symbolizing the end.\n—[<color=#DC143C><size=50>0:00:00</size></color>]

Title: Alternate Route
EventDesc: Just as you are about to enter the monster's lair, the Access Key tucked in your pocket emits a red shimmer.

Title: Alternate Route
RoleContent: I see. It's a hidden area covered by holograms.
EventDesc: After you take out the access key from your pocket, the landscape around you undergoes a sudden transformation. The once enclosed space unveils a new path that extends before you.

Title: Reverb Beyond
EventDesc: The red arrow can strip away your abilities upon impact, empowering the creation of even stronger monsters.\nWell aware of this perilous truth, you clutch the key to the world beyond in your hand. This is the final showdown.

Title: Reverb Beyond
RoleContent: Chosen One, I will always be by your side.
EventDesc: Firmly holding Jetavie's hand, you step onto the stage of the end.

Title: Reverb Beyond
EventDesc: —[<color=#DC143C><size=50>0:00:00</size></color>]

Title: Industrial Mystery
EventDesc: As you push open the heavy metal gate of the under-construction hall, your eyes are greeted by the sight of rusted industrial machines scattered amidst the debris. In this resting ground of machine remains, you catch a faint whisper.

Title: Industrial Mystery
EventDesc: A guide robot, with its solar panel broken in half, leans against the wall, uttering words like "welcome to the exhibition" in a fragmented manner.

Title: Industrial Mystery
EventDesc: With a suspicion that fear may be distorting your perception, you quickly snatch the spare toolbox left behind by someone and pivot to depart before paranoia takes hold.

Title: Industrial Mystery
EventDesc: You remove its monitor and force it to "go off duty."

Title: Industrial Mystery
EventDesc: Feeling concerned that this could be a trap, you decide to retrace your steps, grabbing the spare toolbox that had been left behind and turning to leave.

Title: Little Favor
EventDesc: As you fumble around in the dimly lit room, your hands come across a yellowed notepad. Opening it, you discover some chips inside, along with a note that reads,\n"Honored guest, could you please go to my garden and water the cornflowers? Please accept this small gesture of appreciation..."

Title: Little Favor
EventDesc: While watering the cornflowers for the garden owner, you uncover a delicate treasure chest nestled within the moist soil. Perhaps this is the owner's true intention.

Title: Little Favor
EventDesc: There's no reason to pass up any useful resources—what you see is what you get.

Title: Little Favor
EventDesc: Jetavie and you find a note on the desk in the study. Written on it is the way to enter the secret room, the location of the item, and the password for the entrance.

Title: Little Favor
EventDesc: A simple gift box sits underneath the note, which you grab on your way out.

Title: Art Forger
EventDesc: When you and Jetavie are looking for a way out of the museum, you come across a man who's replicating a statue. The man claims to be an artisan and the fake David on exhibition next door is his work. Jetavie doesn't believe him and thinks he's bragging about himself, which makes him very angry.

Title: Art Forger
EventDesc: Enraged, the artisan claims there's nothing in the museum he can't forge. And he would give you something he has if you can name one thing that he can't forge.

Title: Art Forger
EventDesc: No big deal. Just need to find the fragrances in the paint. The art forger says dismissively. He then gives you a little gift and asks you to leave.

Title: Art Forger
EventDesc: Unfortunately, I'm an expert in music. This is a piece of cake.\nThe art forger scoffs at your answer but thinks it's creative. He gives you a small gift to thank you.

Title: Art Forger
EventDesc: Yeah... Even if you paint the floor white, at the end of the day, it's not the real moonlight. The art forger admits his defeat to you.

Title: Flawed Creation
EventDesc: You accidentally stumble upon an empty sculpture section, where two contrasting marble statues are positioned. On the left stands the iconic Venus de Milo, while on the right rests a replica of Michelangelo's David.

Title: Flawed Creation
EventDesc: Your hand passes right through the sculptures, revealing that they are not authentic pieces from the Louvre but, instead, mere holographic projections. Disappointed, you removed the external storage device from the projection unit.

Title: Flawed Creation
EventDesc: The replica of David lacks the exquisiteness expected, and a cursory glance is enough to notice the difference. Upon closer examination, you discover that David's left eye has been replaced with a capsule.

Title: Flawed Creation
EventDesc: In an effort to maintain harmony between David and Venus' flawed beauty, you decide to remove the capsule that serves as David's eye.

Title: Flawed Creation
EventDesc: The capsule is the only innovation that sets the David replica apart from the original. You can't bear taking it away, so you turn around and leave the hall.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: You meet a mysterious caped woman at the exhibition hall.\nShe's looking at an oil painting named "Lovers Died at the Battlefield".

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: It depicts two lovers holding their hands while leaning against broken walls. One stares ahead tiredly, and the other holds a weapon that is out of ammo with a smile.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The woman asks you what message the painting conveys.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The woman calmly turns to leave without saying anything. For a moment, her cape lifts and blocks your view, making the painting disappear like magic. The reflection of you and Jetavie in the empty frame makes you both look like the lovers in the painting. Meanwhile, you notice a yellowed note pinned to the wall.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The woman nods to show agreement. She takes out a note from her sleeve, gives it to you, and walks out without looking back.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The light that parts the sea of emptiness will reach another shore.\n\n                                                           —Mechanoid Gospel II

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: Two lost souls. One has no future, the other has no power.\n\n                                                           —Mechanoid Gospel I

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The mysterious woman is gone, but you find an item she left on the floor—an orphanage employee ID card.

Title: Jetavie's Game
EventDesc: Upon reaching the courtyard, you are greeted by a multitude of peculiar abandoned dolls. Jetavie, who was holding your hand, abruptly releases her grip and darts away as you glance around.

Title: Jetavie's Game
RoleContent: Close your eyes and count to ten. No cheating...
EventDesc: She wants to play hide-and-seek with you.

Title: Jetavie's Game
EventDesc: After the countdown ends, you open your eyes and survey the surroundings.

Title: Jetavie's Game
EventDesc: You inspect the torn-open back of the plush bear and find it hollowed out, with enough space to accommodate an adult. Jetavie is nowhere to be found within it, but someone may have used this hiding spot previously. Curiosity piqued, you reach out and explore the insides of the toy.

Title: Jetavie's Game
EventDesc: The nurse's pale lips have been painted bright red. Could this be Jetavie's work? You gently stroke the dusty lips and proceed to check the pocket of the nurse's uniform.

Title: Jetavie's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie pulls out a gift box as a reward from behind her back.

Title: Jetavie's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie is standing behind your back.

Title: Impoverished Collector
EventDesc: You come across a man standing alone in the museum, deeply engrossed in admiring the paintings. He reveals that he was once an avid collector but, due to his passion for purchasing artworks, he now finds himself in a desperate need for money. He suggests the possibility of exchanging certain items with you.

Title: Impoverished Collector
EventDesc: You generously offer the man some money as an act of charity. As you do so, the artist pulls out an exquisite portable TV from his suitcase.

Title: Impoverished Collector
EventDesc: You have little interest in the poor collector and remain skeptical about the potential value of his offerings. You decline the man's request.

Title: The Staggerer
EventDesc: You and Jetavie see an old man staggering with a walking stick. He walks past you without any sound of footsteps.

Title: The Staggerer
EventDesc: The old man's figure stays for a moment before the safe on the second floor and then disappears at the door of the storage room at the end of the corridor.

Title: The Staggerer
EventDesc: The safe is filled with envelopes. Most of them are thank-you letters from adoptive families, praising the director for his great kindness. However, there is an anonymous threatening letter among them.

Title: The Staggerer
RoleContent: There seems to be a secret alcove in the wall.
EventDesc: You carefully open the letter and read a section of it.\n"I know you've made a fortune on those kids... Pay me if you don't want others to find out."

Title: The Staggerer
EventDesc: Inside is a rusty pistol and a box of supplies

Title: The Staggerer
EventDesc: The storage room is locked. You and Jetavie break open it. Inside the room are group photos of the orphanage staff and the orphans.

Title: The Staggerer
RoleContent: There seems to be a space behind the wallpaper.
EventDesc: Jetavie stares at the photos for a long time and seems to have noticed something.

Title: The Staggerer
EventDesc: Large amounts of treasure fall out after the wallpaper is removed, including pearls and other valuable items.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: You arrive at an animal cemetery before the orphanage, where dead animals were buried. Each tombstone has the name of the corresponding animal's name.

Title: Animal Cemetery
RoleContent: This place is creepy. Let's get going...
EventDesc: You find a metal tip on the ground near the tomb. It seems there's something buried down there.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: After removing the dirt, you find a rusty iron box with a diary inside. It seems the author was working at the orphanage.\n"I've got to hide them away. No one can find them. They're all mine! Forever!"

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: Jetavie finds several suspicious spots nearby.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: You find some cat bones in a corner of the cemetery.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: You buried them. On your way back home, the sky gradually turns clear.\nAt the exit of the cemetery, you and Jetavie find a black giftbox left by someone.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: You search for a while but only find some chips. The rain is getting bigger, you have to give up and prepare to leave.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: Jetavie digs out a skeleton that's way bigger than you expected. You determine this is a human skeleton. There's a gold necklace around its neck with the old orphanage director's name engraved on it. Why is he here? Perhaps his death was not natural.

Title: Animal Cemetery
RoleContent: This should be what's mentioned in the journal.
EventDesc: It's a dry well. You get a heavy black box out from the bottom of the well.

Title: Animal Cemetery
EventDesc: You feel a bit off here, so you follow Jetavie's advice and leave in a hurry.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
EventDesc: You and Jetavie get lost in the misty forest. You come across a cabin right before you run out of energy. Luckily, there are kitchen tools in it. Jetavie suggests to have a meal before setting off again. She seems proud of her cooking and volunteers to cook for you.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
EventDesc: You check on the ingredients you have. There is some salt and rice that have expired, vinegar and MSG that have gone bad, some mushrooms and wild fruits Jetavie has gotten from somewhere, and a dying hare that came at your door.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
RoleContent: Voila! All courses' ready! Dig in!
EventDesc: After a while, Jetavie walks out of the kitchen with three hot dishes and asks you to have a taste with enthusiasm.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
RoleContent: Why are you rolling on the ground, Chosen One?
EventDesc: The cramps in your stomach make you curl up and roll on the ground, knocking over an old vase nearby. A black iron box falls out of the broken vase.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
EventDesc: After having it, you starts to see colorful little figures dancing on the celling, and then you black out. When you wake up again, you see Jetavie desperately trying to bring you back, looking panicked.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
RoleContent: (Sobs) I thought you couldn't wake up.
EventDesc: Seeing you sit up, Jetavie gradually calms down. To apologize, she gives you some chips she has secretly hidden away.

Title: Jetavie's Ingredients
EventDesc: You had the vegetables and are still alive. Besides, you think they taste good. In recognition of your bravery, Jetavie gives you a delicate giftbox.

Title: Kind Induction
EventDesc: You come across a man with glasses, leisurely seated on a bench feeding pigeons. He shares that he used to work as a psychologist at an orphanage, offering his assistance in conquering your inner demons. Curiously, he asks if you have ever gotten a capsule.

Title: Kind Induction
EventDesc: Turning his gaze upon Jetavie standing behind you, the man presents you with a prophecy.\n"Losing the Eye of Horus, you shall be the one to lay the girl to rest."

Title: Kind Induction
EventDesc: Shuddering in his laugh, the man retrieves a glass of water and asks if you are willing to confront the truth of the world.

Title: Kind Induction
EventDesc: Unable to discern whether the man is a doctor or a patient, you cannot dismiss the possibility that he may have poisoned the water. Therefore, you refuse the man's offer and leave.

Title: Kind Induction
EventDesc: After consuming the capsule, you don't experience any stomach cramps or intense dizziness—nothing happens at all. You begin to suspect that the man is simply fooling you, so you leave with Jetavie.

Title: Kind Induction
EventDesc: Offering no response, the man puts something in your hand and leaves.

Title: The Lost Hall
EventDesc: Jetavie comes across a boy in the orphanage, who appears to have been trapped here for an entire week. Miraculously, the boy has managed to survive on expired food during this time.

Title: The Lost Hall
EventDesc: The boy claims to be separated from his sister and wants you to help him find her so he can go home.

Title: The Lost Hall
EventDesc: Despite the presence of numerous beasts in the vicinity, you agree to the boy's plea. Leaving some food behind, you and Jetavie leave to look for his sister.

Title: The Lost Hall
EventDesc: Knowing the presence of many wild beasts in the vicinity, you decide against risking your life to assist the boy in finding his sister. You propose that he follows you back to the town, but the boy refuses your offer.

Title: Wild Forest
EventDesc: You and Jetavie venture into the forest in front of the orphanage, surrounded by the echoing cries of wild beasts.

Title: Wild Forest
RoleContent: Hello there, I got separated from my little brother. Have you ever seen him...
EventDesc: As you explore the area, you run into a young girl collecting insect samples.

Title: Wild Forest
EventDesc: You share the information about the trapped boy in the orphanage with the girl, who deeply appreciates your courageous efforts in searching for him. She willingly agrees to join you and follow you back.

Title: Wild Forest
EventDesc: The girl tells you that this is a stag beetle, a very rare and valuable species. She ventured into the forest with the intention of earning money to support her brother's education.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Walking into the orphanage, you sense a hint of hostility in the air. Two figures flash past you. A fight starts between a crimson-eyed purple-haired girl wielding her beastly sharp claws and a gray-haired boy with a butterfly knife.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: You don't know why they fight, but you think you've seen them somewhere. You can't remember anything, and even thinking about it gives you a headache.\nSoon, the purple-haired girl's claw pierces through the boy's chest. She turns toward you the moment the boy falls.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: The purple-haired girl's faster than you. With power beyond that of a human, she grips you by the neck and opens her bloody mouth. Her face reminds you of something.\n\n—You saw her once in the future, when she was still human.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Just as you are about to lose consciousness, a red laser beam comes from the distance and pierces right through the purple-haired girl's forehead, saving you from the edge of suffocation. You look up and see a mysterious woman leaving the attic. She raises her right hand, and a note falls from her fingertips.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Sweet fruits do not lead to the real Eden.\n\n                                                           —Mechanoid Gospel III

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: At the critical moment, you avoid the attack and take Jetavie out in a hurry. After getting rid of the purple-haired girl, you find yourself holding her blanket. It's not loot, but you find a mysterious tube of serum in it.

Title: Demihuman Girl
RoleContent: Have you brought what I lost?
EventDesc: Seeing the ID card in your hand, the purple-haired girl stops and looks scared. She turns around and flees.\nMeanwhile, the mysterious caped woman appears again. She picks up the blanket the girl left on the ground, dusts off it, and throws it on.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: The mysterious woman takes the orphanage employee ID card. She gives you a lab employee ID card and leaves.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: The mysterious woman turns to leave without saying anything.

Title: Cold-Hearted
EventDesc: In the lab's sterile room, a poor mouse is tied up by the archive's power cord. Jetavie reminds you that the archive may contain something you need.

Title: Cold-Hearted
EventDesc: At the instant you cut the power cord, the archive shuts down as part of its security protocols. The mouse you rescued scampers off and disappears into an inconspicuous crack in the wall. Moments later, it reemerges, pushing something toward you.

Title: Cold-Hearted
EventDesc: Amidst the screams of the little mouse, the door of the archive opens gradually. You and Jetavie make your way inside and find several usable data sets.

Title: Top Player
EventDesc: You and Jetavie arrive at a facility resembling a rest area, where you notice a gaming machine. It's equipped with a non-invasive brain-computer interface, offering prizes for every cleared stage.

Title: Top Player
EventDesc: It is a very entertaining maze game. You still feel the urge to continue playing after Jetavie forcefully unplugs your brain connector.

Title: Top Player
EventDesc: Despite your strong desire to try this gaming machine, you decide not to linger around, considering its potential safety hazards.

Title: Lethal Mistake
EventDesc: On your way, you come across a dilapidated lab facility with shattered glass strewn across the floor. A white lab coat hangs on the wall, and you find a bloodstained experiment journal tucked inside.

Title: Lethal Mistake
EventDesc: Wanted to build a reactor for fun and ended up getting way too much radiation. Dammit. There's something in the safe. Go get it. The combination is 1234.

Title: Lethal Mistake
EventDesc: It looks like something terrible has happened here, so it's better to stay out of trouble. Take whatever is useful and leave quickly.

Title: Fire Scene
EventDesc: You enter a research facility and find a body lying on the ground. It's wrapped in a burnt white gown with half a cigarette and a large amount of sodium metal scraps.

Title: Fire Scene
EventDesc: Something horrible seems to have happened here. Clues of this accident might also lead to something unexpected...

Title: Fire Scene
EventDesc: Apparently, the careless researcher lit a cigarette in the lab to relax but triggered the sprinkler system on the ceiling. This then triggered a chemical reaction between the water and the sodium metal and led to a violent explosion.

Title: Fire Scene
EventDesc: In the hand of the body, you find several pages with the locations of the lab's ventilation ducts and secret passages. It strikes you that perhaps the body before you was not a researcher but a thief who attempted to seal the supplies...\nHe might have lit a cigarette to relax after breaking in and accidentally set the place on fire.

Title: Fire Scene
EventDesc: It doesn't make sense for a lab with so much sodium to have a sprinkler system.\nConsidering the researcher is a smoker, they should have adopted heat detectors instead of smoke detectors. This might be a homicide. All of these make you want to look deeper.

Title: Fire Scene
EventDesc: You find a diary hidden by the researcher.\n\n"The hunt for researchers is becoming increasingly urgent. Fortunately, I've moved all important supplies to the basement where they put cleaning tools. Once I..."

Title: Silent Catastrophe
EventDesc: You keenly perceive the lab's holographic traps and cautiously walk around those peculiar mental interference devices.

Title: Silent Catastrophe
EventDesc: As you and Jetavie reach the hidden space atop the spiral staircase, you notice a grotesque monster lurking behind her. Surprisingly, she seems unable to see it.

Title: Silent Catastrophe
EventDesc: It appears that you possess the ability to see the monster, possibly due to the effects of the capsule you took.\n"You are the only one who can see the monster; this is a fight of yours alone."

Title: Silent Catastrophe
EventDesc: Under Jetavie's astonished gaze, you drag her away from this place.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: You step into an unnervingly straight corridor within the neuroscience research center. You continue walking along its path, only to find that it elongates with your strides.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: You can't find the exit, and you realize it's the third time you have passed by the massive oil painting on the wall—something is repeatedly occurring.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: As you suspected, the device concealed behind the painting emits a unique range of sound waves, creating an illusion in your human brain that the circular corridor extends straight ahead.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Congratulations. When you wake up from the dream\nboth your body and soul escape from that eerie corridor.\nGlancing at Jetavie, who is peacefully napping against your shoulder, you let out a sigh of relieve.

Title: Inheritance
EventDesc: You meet a man in an inconspicuous corner who appears to have lost his prosthetic limb. With an expression of shame, he shares his story with you.

Title: Inheritance
EventDesc: The man, inheriting his master's robotic arm, came to challenge a monster. However, overwhelmed by fear during the confrontation, he fled in disarray and failed to secure even his master's legacy.

Title: Inheritance
EventDesc: You depart from this cowardly man, leaving him in his grief alone.\n"One must face their chosen destiny and bear the consequences that come with it."

Title: Inheritance
EventDesc: It's strong, agile, ruthless, but not invincible. If only I had been braver...

Title: Inheritance
EventDesc: Inspired, the man struggles to pull a bloodied weapon from behind him, the only thing he has left. He wishes to entrust you with what remains of his will to fight.

Title: Inheritance
EventDesc: Knowing that mere words may offer limited comfort, you still give the man who lost his arm some gentle words, hoping he can let go of his obsession with revenge and move on in his life.

Title: Failed Creation
EventDesc: You run into three young people at the research center seeking help.
ConfirmContent: Approach and ask if she is all right.

Title: Failed Creation
EventDesc: Lily, the pink-haired girl leading the group, reveals that one among them has turned into a man-eating monster due to a failed experiment. However, with their human appearance maintained, it's difficult to distinguish between them. Maybe you can lend her a hand.

Title: Failed Creation
RoleContent: Doesn't look like an evil one...
EventDesc: The gray-haired wolf-child dons tattered jeans, and a few scars can be faintly seen on his bare upper body. You toss some food toward him, and in return, he retrieves supplies from his pocket to offer you.

Title: Failed Creation
RoleContent: Something feels suspicious. Could it be her?
EventDesc: Your attention is drawn to the purple-haired girl, who is tightly clutching a blanket and trembling beside a cardboard box. Her pale complexion and slender limbs reveal faintly visible veins beneath her skin. She appears to be extremely terrified of strangers.

Title: Failed Creation
RoleContent: After a closer look, this Lily sure is a stunner.
EventDesc: Lily, the girl who took the initiative to greet you, is adorned in a clean dress. She exudes an outgoing and cheerful demeanor, her radiant smile devoid of any trace of gloom.

Title: Failed Creation
EventDesc: In the end, you still can't see through the monster's disguise. After bidding farewell to the three, you leave with Jetavie.

Title: Old Friendship
EventDesc: As you continue exploring the grimy building, you encounter Lily once more. She is now wrapped in a blanket, a joyful blush adorning her cheeks. Upon spotting you, she warmly greets you.

Title: Old Friendship
EventDesc: Lily's face lights up with pure joy as she lays eyes on you once more. She openly shows her feelings for you, expressing her desire to join you in your journey.

Title: Old Friendship
RoleContent: She's got a thing for you.
EventDesc: Considering the potential dangers that lie ahead on your journey, you decline Lily's request.\nIn the end, Lily leaves a gentle kiss on your cheek before departing.

Title: Old Friendship
RoleContent: Are you an idiot, Chosen One?
EventDesc: Jetavie firmly rejects your idea of accepting Lily's request.\n"Didn't you see the blood stain on her blanket?"

Title: Old Friendship
EventDesc: In the end, Lily leaves a gentle kiss on your cheek before departing. Concerned about her safety, you share some supplies with her.

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc:
You walk into a biology research center full of sticky blood and creepy scratches.
Through the experiment journal, you've learned that there was once an illegal experiment where the researchers attempted to create some kind of demihuman by injecting monster serum into human beings.

—The experiment failed, and the failed creations became ogres.

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc: You find a card between the two monitors with scribbles from a test subject child to their friends.\n\n"We can't get out without power. I'll inject for myself... Kill me before I turn into a monster."

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc: A weird sound comes from behind. You turn around and realize you're in danger—the monster locked up in the quarantine zone has broken free from the chains.

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc: It requires an employee ID card to get to the safe zone. When you're busy trying to get through, the monster has already come behind you...

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc: The serum gives you the might to fight the monster, but your body is also being corrupted.

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc:
Once entering the safe zone, you'll find a yellowed note on the table.

"The Holy Child drank the holy dew and was born to the new world."

                                                           —Mechanoid Gospel IV

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc: As your heart races, the rampant monster suddenly stops.\nThrough the gap, you see the mysterious caped woman appears once again behind it. She puts a delicate box on the ground and leaves with the fierce monster.

Title: Forbidden Verification
EventDesc: You find a secret escape passage under the table. After Jetavie confirms it's safe, you leave through it.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: You and Jetavie enter a deserted, unpowered tunnel in the research center.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: A secret crack with a blue glow attracts you when you're searching in the darkness. It seems there's a dark grid space behind the crack.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: You find a door at the end of the grid space. You push it open carefully, and a blinding flare comes toward you.\nIn the darkness, materials with data fluorescence are burning in the fire.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: You decide not to risk it. However, when you turn to leave, Jetavie, who has been standing behind you, is missing.

Title: Blue Crack
RoleContent: You find something weird in a weird place.
EventDesc: You've been searching for Jetavie anxiously until she emerges at the other end of the tunnel.\nHer hair seems a bit burnt, and she is holding a fluorescent object.\nWhen you ask if she's injured or not in surprise, she shakes her head calmly.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: >>>The First Success "We got a stable personality from training for the first time. The validation data were excellent, and everyone felt satisfied..." "Unfortunately, it's a shame that the model was determined to be 'overfitting' and thus has no potential..." "Perhaps we would be rewarded with interesting data if we keep training based on these parameters." —Progress Research Log I

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: You put away the materials and are ready to leave.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: The burning sensation hurts, but you still manage to save a collection of materials from the fire.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc:
<size=25>>>></size>■■■

<size=30>It was an accident. The researcher put in wrong parameters but got a surprisingly stable personality through training.</size>

<size=30>"The personality is too disjointed that it has nothing in common with the origin Memory sample. It's naughty and even childish."</size>

<size=30>"However, it actually suggests that the personality is highly adaptable and resembles the autonomously awakened individual..."</size>

<size=30>                                         —Progress Research Log II</size>

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: You put away the materials and prepare to leave the space.

Title: Blue Crack
EventDesc: After the fire is out, the ashes turn into several processing units. You recycle the computing power.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: Inside the building, looming trees spread their lush foliage into every corner. There, you encounter a girl dressed in a cloak praying.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: She wants to pray to these towering mutant trees for you.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: The girl begins reciting a complex incantation, but Jetavie, suspecting she is simply fooling you, quickly pulls you away from the scene.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: Luckily, nothing bad happens, and you even find some supplies afterward.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: There's no light in the girl's eyes. As a blind girl, she cannot see what you and Jetavie look like, only staring calmly straight ahead.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: The girl shares with you that she once made a wish to the god of the trees, willingly trading her sight in exchange for the ability to offer protection to others. Regardless, she wishes to pray for you.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: An inexplicable fear courses through you. Without further questioning, you take Jetavie away from the eerie girl.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: After bidding farewell to the girl, you stumble upon a supply crate on the way.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: Moved by compassion for the young girl, you decline the prayer that had caused her harm. Then, you leave the place with Jetavie.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: After bidding farewell to the girl, you run into some special supplies on your way.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: The witch under the tree frowns as if your question reminds her of an unpleasant past. Hearing Jetavie's voice, she immediately reaches out to touch her face and hair. Afterward, she uncharacteristically pulls out the dagger at her waist...

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: You quickly subdue the witch, but her knife still manages to cut you. You take the dagger from her, before taking Jetavie away from this place.

Title: Witch Under the Tree
EventDesc: You apologize to the witch, hoping that she will not hurt Jetavie. She quickly calms down, realizing that revenge will not bring the god of the trees back—she will hold onto her faith as the last disciple. As an apology for her reckless attack, she takes out a weapon box and hands it to you.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: You come across a database, but the lock on the door is damaged and cannot be opened. You notice a narrow ventilation duct nearby, but its size is too small for you to access.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie taps you on the shoulder, looking at you in excitement.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: You tie one end of the rope to Jetavie and tell her to call out loudly if she encounters any danger. Jetavie nods in understanding. Not long after she enters, a sudden and agonizing scream pierces the air.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Fearing potential dangers in the duct, you pull Jetavie out of the area.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie eventually returns safely, explaining that she screamed upon the sight of a chubby rat inside, which caused her to feel physically and mentally unwell.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Despite her failed attempt to enter the database, Jetavie still found some scattered supplies in the duct.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie eventually returns with a data box in her arms, but she vents her frustration on you.\nBecause when she ran into a rat in the ventilation duct, you callously ignored her.

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc: The eerie howling of the night winds and the distant wails of wild animals bring you and Jetavie to a halt in your tracks. You decide to take a break before dawn.

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc: In the flickering candlelight, an unexplainable sense of panic consumes you.\nJetavie notices your distress as you struggle to fall asleep, and she suggests telling a bedtime story to help alleviate your unease.

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc:
Once upon a long, there was a traveler who stepped into the red tide alone.
They encountered a witch who offered guidance, not knowing she hailed from the same origin as the enemy.
The two continued their journey together.
In the end of the story—
The witch stood alone among sand-covered tombstones,
bidding a grateful farewell to the traveler...

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc:
Once upon a time, there existed a man renowned as a hero and a witch who offered him protection.
Together, they managed to capture the final remaining cities of their enemy.
Hovering above the enemy lines, a god made a promise to the man, granting him the fulfillment of any wish.
However, the cost of this wish entailed sacrificing a loved one, and the man sacrificed the witch who stood by his side.
Thus, the evil god's deceitful ploy triumphed...

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc: The words that escape Jetavie's lips have a knack for sending a shiver down one's spine. It might be wise to lull her to sleep before she begins telling horror stories.

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc: As you ponder the implications of the story, exhaustion clouds your consciousness.

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc: As you ponder the implications of the story, exhaustion clouds your consciousness.

Title: Jetavie's Story Time
EventDesc: Jetavie soon falls asleep.

Title: Machine Technician
EventDesc: You come across a cloaked mechanoid who introduces itself as a technician with a deep passion for disassembling and assembling machines. It mentions that even its companions have been disassembled into parts.\nIt seems that you can exchange chips for something useful with him.

Title: Machine Technician
EventDesc: The mechanical technician grows slightly impatient and casually hands you a strange portable TV.

Title: Machine Technician
EventDesc: The mechanical technician grows slightly impatient and casually hands you an ordinary portable TV.

Title: Machine Technician
EventDesc: The mechanical technician seems in a good mood and gives you an exquisite portable TV.

Title: Machine Technician
EventDesc: You suspect that it holds some evil intention and reject it without much thinking.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: You accidentally become separated from Jetavie underground and even lose your navigator.\nIn a daze, you find a spiral staircase leading up to the surface. However, regardless of how many steps you climb, you find yourself inexplicably back at the starting point.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Finally, you meet Jetavie again, who angrily questions you about leaving her behind and losing the important navigator.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Holding your hand, Jetavie leads you to ascend the stairs until you hear the voice of a second Jetavie.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: You turn around, and the second Jetavie stops you in your tracks. Only now do you find yourself on the edge of the building, one step away from falling into the pit. The Jetavie you saw a moment ago seems to be a mere hallucination.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: As you speculated, Jetavie, who has lost contact with you, cannot possibly know about you losing the navigator. Your punch lands on a mechanoid disguised in a holographic projection with a mental interference device equipped.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Another Jetavie appears before you, and you throw your fist at the illusion again. However, before your strike lands, you are hit to the ground by a swing punch from her.

Title: Mobius
RoleContent: Hey, I've been looking for you forever! What's wrong with you?
EventDesc: This time, it is Jetavie herself who appears before you. Her punch feels more real than ever, incredibly convincing. After offering your apologies, she helps you get back on your feet.

Title: Noble Heart
EventDesc: On the way, you encounter an aged witch whose face is marked by numerous sores. She is immediately drawn to the beam sword in your hand.

Title: Noble Heart
EventDesc: The witch tells you that she once saw a man and his apprentice wielding this weapon. Fearing her witch curse, they drove her away, but this time, the witch expresses her desire to offer her prayers for you.

Title: Noble Heart
EventDesc: Upon accepting the blessing from the elderly woman, a surge of scorching courage fills your chest, igniting within you like a spark that sets hay ablaze.

Title: Noble Heart
EventDesc: The witch expresses no surprise at your decision, recognizing that humans, being naturally wary creatures, tend to be sensitive to the goodwill of others. You bid the woman a friendly goodbye.

Title: Multiple Choice
EventDesc: You come to a facility where doors numbered [Zero] through [Ten] appear in front of you.

Title: Multiple Choice
RoleContent: I suggest you choose Door Seven.
EventDesc: A notice next to the doors informs you that there are nine traps and one treasure inside them.

Title: Multiple Choice
RoleContent: Just so you know, seven is my lucky number.
EventDesc: You successfully obtain the strange treasure from Room [Seven], and you ask Jetavie for the secret to locating the treasure.

Title: Multiple Choice
EventDesc: Well, escaping might seem embarrassing, but it's actually pretty useful. And why risk it on some probability question that even an elementary school kid could solve? Plus, my suggestion was just based on my lucky number...

Title: Consequence Unknown
EventDesc: After acquiring the treasure through the Ten Gates option, you continue on your journey. However, as you travel, there's this constant chill down your spine and an unspoken sense of unease that lingers in the air.

Title: Consequence Unknown
EventDesc: Your intuition proves correct as you realize that the Door [Seven] you chose is, in fact, a trap. Anyone who enters this door is bound to be pursued by the guardian.\n"The guardian stands in your way at this moment."

Title: Consequence Unknown
EventDesc: The treasure attracts the guardian's attention, allowing you to successfully escape the danger.

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: You and Jetavie come to the center of the deep well. A crimson figure flashes through the dark tunnel.

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: Seeing the monster's fangs, you and Jetavie start to run like crazy. However, the anticipated attack never comes.\nYou find the monster's cave nearby with a crimson crack hidden inside. Although you have no idea where it leads, you are aware that it's an invitation to the abyss...

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: In the grid space, you see a monster tearing the void at the end of the road with massive data flowing out from its mouth.\nAmong piles of junk data, a sparkling data crystal catches your attention. There seem to be some fluorescent words on it.

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: You throw a stone at the crimson crack. A few seconds later, a red gem comes out from the void and hits Jetavie on the forehead.

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: The gem gives off a dim red light. You don't know what it means but put it away instinctively and leave with Jetavie.

Title: Crimson Monster
RoleContent: Hey! It wasn't me! Stop chasing me!
EventDesc: Jetavie starts running. You throw the materials you collected earlier at the monster.\nThe monster turns around in pain and goes after Jetavie.\nMeanwhile, you pick up the data crystal left by the monster. Through observation, you find some blurry quantum-state text on it.

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: >>>Hidden Layer Having two different training clusters "Alpha & Beta" using the same hidden layer means... "The personality is too disjointed that it has nothing in common with the origin Memory sample. It's naughty and even childish." "However, it actually suggests that the personality is highly adaptable and resembles the autonomously awakened individual..." —Progress Research Log III

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: You put away the crystal, distract the monster with Jetavie, and get out of the void crack successfully.

Title: Crimson Monster
EventDesc: You speed up, trying to pass the monster. But the monster is more agile than you have expected. You can't even get close to the data crystal. Unfortunately, you have to leave with Jetavie through the void crack before the monster gets to you.

Title: Fake Knowledge
EventDesc: Unintentionally, you find yourself in an abandoned stargazer, stumbling upon Robot A, who asserts being stranded here due to an accident.

Title: Fake Knowledge
EventDesc: While trapped, Robot A has diligently sketched numerous star charts of the night sky above. Curiosity leads you to inspect its artwork, only to realize a glaring issue:\nThe constellations it is depicting are clearly incorrect.

Title: Fake Knowledge
EventDesc: The chip within the robot is an inferior product, mass-produced in the previous century. This subpar component would significantly impair a robot's vision sensors, possibly explaining why Robot A is unable to accurately identify constellations.

Title: Fake Knowledge
EventDesc: Only humans have access to this system.\nAfter entering the system, you turn off the star projection on the stargazer dome.\nRobot A expresses gratitude to you because it can finally lay eyes on the real night sky.

Title: Fake Hero
EventDesc: You meet a righteous detective named Robert underground, who claims that some nefarious organization is hiding in the depths of this building, and many civilians are trapped here.

Title: Fake Hero
EventDesc: After you break into the cult's base with Robert, he finds his own daughter there, who has become the cult's leader... Robert pleads with you to keep this secret.

Title: Fake Hero
EventDesc: People naturally tend to be drawn to heroes they recognize and acknowledge. Detective Robert, being the embodiment of justice, carries the weight of that symbol, and his image should not and cannot be shaken by situations like this.

Title: Fake Hero
EventDesc: As shadows always accompany the sunlight, maintaining a false image would breed evil. By harboring it, you also become part of the shadow.

Title: Fake Hero
EventDesc: You let Detective Robert know that his daughter was not born a bad person, and she only became the cultist leader due to an accident. You tell him that there is nothing to be ashamed of, but Robert is skeptical of what you said. Meanwhile, the young "cultist leader" recognizes Jetavie, who is standing behind you.

Title: Fake Hero
EventDesc: You comfort Detective Rober and tell him that Jetavie will testify when the time comes to prove his daughter's innocence. Surprised, Robert offers you generous rewards as a token of appreciation.

Title: Fake Talent
RoleContent: The long endeavor has gifted me a talent like no other.
EventDesc: You encounter a lone bard underground, claiming to have journeyed far and wide to craft the greatest book of poetry ever written.

Title: Fake Talent
EventDesc: The man offers to write a narrative poem for you in exchange for payment. Jetavie, unimpressed however, skillfully improvises several poems on the spot in a similar style, causing the timid poet to blush in embarrassment.

Title: Fake Talent
EventDesc: The poet has composed a lengthy poem for you and Jetavie about an adventurer and their haughty little maid. However, this time he has a change of heart and refuses to accept payment, citing it as an act in the name of art.

Title: Fake Talent
EventDesc: You ask whether the poet would be interested in purchasing Jetavie's poems. Initially, he sternly declines, but out of curiosity, he eventually buys one and commends Jetavie's talent for embracing the art of poetry.

Title: False Memory
EventDesc: When you go through the tunnel, a refugee suddenly rushes out from darkness and hugs Jetavie's leg. He claims that Jetavie saved his life, but Jetavie doesn't seem to know him.

Title: False Memory
EventDesc: The refugee tells you about the Jetavie he met before—\n"With the incredible weapon in her hand, she's able to fight multiple monsters at the same time like the goddess of war."

Title: False Memory
RoleContent: Why do you keep changing your story...?
EventDesc: The refugee stutters. He claims to have seen Jetavie holding a giant spear and then says it should be a black cannon.

Title: False Memory
RoleContent: She seemed to be chasing after something alone...
EventDesc: The chip you gave the refugee seems to have reminded him of something, but he can't make it clear.

Title: False Memory
EventDesc: You don't believe the refugee and turn to leave.

Title: False Memory
RoleContent: I'll just return it to you!
EventDesc: The refugee stutters. He can't recall what that "Jetavie" said. The only thing he remembers is that she gave him a weapon box as a gift. Since he's not good with weapons and you need them more, so he gives the weapon box to you.

Title: False Memory
EventDesc: You accept the weapon box and leave with Jetavie through the secret tunnel.

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: Guided by your visions, you finally arrive at the designated location. An ominous aura emanates from the closed black door, adorned with a bold red number [126]. Standing before you is a young girl who introduces herself as a disciple.

Title: Sisyphus
RoleContent: 126 times. You have lost 126 times here, yet you and that girl still show up before me.
EventDesc: Pathetic Sisyphus, are you still willing to continue pushing that boulder?

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: The disciple observes calmly as you and Jetavie depart from the eerie black door, as if your encounter had never taken place.

Title: Sword of the Brave
EventDesc: Carrying the will of the master and apprentice, and blessed by the witch, you heed the guidance of your heart and come to this door.

Title: Sword of the Brave
EventDesc: Echoes resound in your ears, and your intuition warns you that a formidable adversary has been lying in wait here for far too long.\n"It's time to end this, in whatever manner necessary..."

Title: Sword of the Brave
EventDesc: Overwhelmed by the formidable strength of the enemy, you shudder with fear and, like the man you once met who had lost his prosthetic arm, hastily flee from the scene.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: Walking on the mud, you and Jetavie fall into a void. In the dark space, a silver-white copper mirror floats in the air.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: Instead of the reflection of you and Jetavie, there's a dark vortex in the mirror, which seems to be a portal to another dimension. You notice a slot at the bottom of the mirror.

Title: White Illusion
RoleContent: Seems similar to what's described in the materials we saw.
EventDesc: You put the data crystal before the mirror. The dark vortex disappears, and a white vortex appears. You feel the data crystal is getting hot. Then, several lines of quantum-state text appear vaguely on the mirror.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: >>>Computing Power Exhaustion - It's a good idea to have the two personality models do a cross validation, but it pushed the computers to the limit. - Especially ■■■'s model. It's like a monster feeding on computing power. We have to put a limit on her "appetite." - I'm worried that it would affect the firewall if this continues, but the others don't seem to have the intention to terminate the experiment. - Recently, we've heard bad news from the outside. It seems the whole world is in chaos... —Progress Research Log IV

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: You notice the crystal looks brighter. This seems to be the last part of the data. You put away the crystal and leave.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: You put the bloodstone in the slot under the mirror and it fits perfectly. The vortex in the mirror starts to shake violently. Black tentacles reach out from the mirror and drag both of you back inside.

Title: White Illusion
RoleContent: Careful! There's something off about the mirror!
EventDesc: Jetavie stares at the mirror and suddenly smashes the mirror. The crystal fragments are scattered all over the ground.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: You pick up a fragment. When you put it next to your ear, you can hear it whispering,\n"Tell me what you want, and I will make your wish come true."

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: As you respond, all fragments suddenly disappear, and a giftbox appears in your hands.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: You don't respond and leave with the fragments. After that, you find the fragments in your hand have turned into chips.

Title: White Illusion
EventDesc: You respond, but nothing particular seems to have happened to the fragments. You wait for a long time, and all the fragments suddenly disappear. A bottle of pills appears in your hand.

Title: Alternative Projection
EventDesc: Lost inside the museum, you are seemingly pulled by an unknown energy into an unexplored area. Pushing open the door at the end of the path, you find a projector faintly gleaming before you.

Title: Alternative Projection
EventDesc: You take a step forward, and the red carpet of the museum instantly disappears, replaced with water that almost goes up to your ankle. Jetavie's figure begins to leave you behind, and the light coming from the projector becomes brighter and brighter.

Title: Alternative Projection
EventDesc:
You begin to hear loud noises around you.
You hear many languages, and you can sense countless animated minds.
Eventually, all the vibration converges into an invitation from the void—
"Observe... before the quantum sea collapses."

Title: Alternative Projection
RoleContent: What are you doing staring at the wall, Chosen One?
EventDesc: You hesitate only for a second, and you feel your body being pushed back by an invisible tide. As the door closes once more, you suddenly realize that you have been daydreaming and that the mysterious projector was just a thing of your imagination. For some reason, you feel tired.

Title: Unsuccessful Rescue
EventDesc: Jetavie accidentally falls into a sinkhole. Observing the surroundings, you discover an area seemingly hidden underneath.

Title: Unsuccessful Rescue
EventDesc: Deep underground, Jetavie discovers a temporary shelter, a corpse, and some supplies.

Title: Unsuccessful Rescue
EventDesc: There are still some adjustment tools inside the shelter.

Title: Unsuccessful Rescue
EventDesc: The path forward is dangerous. Jetavie decides to take a break before proceeding.

Title: Unsuccessful Rescue
EventDesc: Time is of the essence. Jetavie forcefully breaks open the underground chamber with her weapon and escapes before it collapses.

Title: Hacker's Challenge
EventDesc: Jetavie enters a strange matrix at the edge of the area and is sealed inside. This is a challenge issued by the so-called Domain Hacker, and she can only leave after she passes the challenge.

Title: Hacker's Challenge
EventDesc: In an instant, Jetavie has defeated all the enemies created by the simulation. Shattered data fragments are scattered onto the ground, turning into supplies.

Title: Hacker's Challenge
EventDesc: After the challenge is complete, an exit appears inside the enclosed space.

Title: Hacker's Challenge
EventDesc: Considering how her equipment has overheated after the high-octane battle, Jestavie decides to take a break here.

Title: Hacker's Challenge
EventDesc: Having gathered the supplies, Jetavie decides to leave as soon as possible and approaches the exit.

Title: Auto Workshop
EventDesc: A labor-free B.E.T.A. workshop using automated processes and advanced AI, equipped with precision modules that enable meticulous adjustments for various projects.

Title: Auto Workshop
RoleContent: To avoid logical fallacies within the system, please exercise caution when making adjustments to the quota...
EventDesc: Activate the B.E.T.A. workshop to adjust.

Title: Auto Workshop
EventDesc: Jetavie decides to enter the workshop and take a break.

Title: Auto Workshop
EventDesc: Jetavie decides to take a quick break outside and leave.

Title: Auto Workshop
EventDesc: Jetavie receives the authority to access the special lab in the workshop.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: Jetavie comes into contact with surprising possibilities in the B.E.T.A world, destabilizing the foundation of the world and introducing subtle changes to causal regularities...

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: Fissures begin to appear in the surrounding area, and loud cracks can be heard from within. A crimson, glowing orb descends before Jetavie like a lightning strike.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: The moment she touches the core, Jetavie is enveloped in a dark, red light and transported to an enclosed dimension. Inside this grid-shaped world, the skipping arc of light forms a sentence.\n<color=#ff6767>"Read the excess data?"</color>

Title: Crimson Core
RoleContent: The energy contained inside is not to be sniffed at...
EventDesc: A blinding light flashes past, and the warped space around her instantly collapses into an extremely small and dense black hole before vanishing. In front of Jetavie is a void device she has never seen in the past.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: Jetavie remains wary of the strange object. Unwilling to stay here for too long, she carefully leaves the crimson dimension.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: As she reads the data, the arc of light forms a sentence.\n<color=#ff6767>"Entropy Change executables not detected. System closing."</color>\nAfterward, the data transforms into a weapon box and falls into Jetavie's hands, and she is transported outside the dimension.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: The data coupling is complete. The simulation entropy increases.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: In the B.E.T.A. world, Jetavie's constant interferences have shaken the foundation of the world again and introduced subtle changes to causal regularities.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: The fissures in the distant sky suddenly expand. The crimson, glowing orb descends before her again like a lightning strike.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: The moment she touches the core, Jetavie is enveloped in a dark, red light and transported to an enclosed dimension. Inside this grid-shaped world, the skipping arc of light forms a sentence.\n<color=#ff6767>"Read the excess data?"</color>

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: A blinding light flashes past, and the warped space around her instantly collapses into an extremely small and dense black hole before vanishing. The void device appears in front of Jetavie again.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: Jetavie is still wary of the strange object. Unwilling to stay here for too long, she carefully leaves the crimson dimension.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: As she reads the data, the arc of light forms a sentence.\n<color=#ff6767>"Entropy Change executables not detected. System closing."</color>\nAfterward, the data transforms into a weapon box and falls into Jetavie's hands, and she is transported outside the dimension.

Title: Crimson Core
EventDesc: The data coupling is complete. The simulation entropy increases.

Title: Cobalt Core
EventDesc: Jetavie and you have experienced a lot in the A.L.P.H.A. world, and your interferences have amassed enough energy for this world and introduced subtle changes to causal regularities...

Title: Cobalt Core
RoleContent: Jetavie is scared of lightning the most...
EventDesc: Fissures begin to appear in the distant sky, and loud cracks threaten to split the clouds. A cobalt, glowing orb descends before you like a lightning strike

Title: Cobalt Core
EventDesc: The moment you touch the core, you are enveloped in a blue light and transported to an enclosed dimension. Inside this grid-shaped world, the skipping arc of light forms a sentence.\n<color=#4a70b9>"Read the excess data?"</color>

Title: Cobalt Core
RoleContent: Not bad! This gotta be good!
EventDesc: A blinding light flashes past, and the warped space around you instantly collapses into an extremely small and dense black hole before vanishing. In front of you is a ring you have never seen in the past, and you believe it is a gift from the void.

Title: Cobalt Core
EventDesc: You worry that the glowing object before you is going to explode, so you carefully leave the blue dimension with Jetavie.

Title: Chance Encounter
EventDesc: Jetavie walks directly into the mist of the Red Tide and senses the enmity in the air. Animosity continues to rise in hidden corners, and Jetavie can smell a familiar scent in it.

Title: Chance Encounter
EventDesc: In the spot where the blood-red mist is the densest stands a strange door. Gray and black rays interweave and radiate around it.

Title: Chance Encounter
RoleContent: Hah, how are you doing, hon?
EventDesc: The moment she touches the door, she hears the sound of an umbrella opening behind her. She turns around and finds a familiar face standing in the Red Tide as playing cards scatter in the air.

Title: Chance Encounter
RoleContent: Do you think you'll win if you try again?
EventDesc: The enemy dodges the attack, but Jetavie aims again, clutching her weapon expressionlessly. As the two confront each other, the platform continues to rise while the surrounding red mist gradually fades, forming a confined arena in mid-air.

Title: Illusory Verses
RoleContent: That door leads to the central area...
EventDesc: The Image of Desire is defeated by Jetavie's overwhelming attacks. As her body slowly breaks down, the weakened computing power returning to the Red Tide, she seems to have whispered a few words toward the door the moment she vanishes.

Title: Illusory Verses
RoleContent: The central area? Where the highest authority is?
EventDesc: Coldly staring at the dissipating Image of Desire, Jetivate ponders her words as she turns around and heads toward the eerie door.

Title: Illusory Verses
RoleContent: It looks like the key doesn't fit, and the door can't be opened right now.
EventDesc: The words "Door to the Truth" are written on the door. There is a strange groove on it, which suggests that the door needs a special key to unlock.

Title: Illusory Verses
EventDesc: A <color=#ff6767>"Queen of Spades"</color> is left behind on the floor by the Image of Desire. Jetavie notices that it contains unbelievable and twisted desires inside, and that strange energy seems to be what drives the Image of Desire.

Title: Illusory Verses
EventDesc: Upon clearing the nearby area, Jetavie discovers the mechanism that activates the platform.

Title: Illusory Verses
EventDesc: The battle has exhausted Jetavie greatly. She decides to take a rest on the spot.

Title: Illusory Verses
EventDesc: Activating the mechanism, Jetavie continues to move up alongside the platform.

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: Jetavie and you reach the battlefield that once brought you despair. Ruined buildings are scattered everywhere, and a pink-haired girl is sitting on top of a toppled pillar, humming an unknown song.

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: You get distracted for a second, and a dark fissure appears behind you. A red arrow shoots out from within the crack, aiming for... Jetavie!

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: You are about to warn her when the red arrow pierces Jetavie's body, and she screams. You try to help her, but an enemy lands between the two of you, blocking your way. Red Tide seeps out from the ground, and the girl with pink hair is long gone.

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: The <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Spades"</color> you took out glows brightly, its blinding light blocking your vision. The card resonates with the dark fissure, and when the light fades, the red arrow and the fissure are both gone. Jetavie and you have managed to avoid a tragedy.

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
RoleContent: Watch out. That lady feels ominous.
EventDesc: You hear someone clap. The girl with pink hair stands up from the toppled pillar, smiling as she walks across the debris-filled space toward you in her white platform shoes.

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
RoleContent: Which mask should I use? Right...
EventDesc: "My dear hardworking Job... How much further do you want to walk for her?"\n"Why don't you stay with me? I'm lonely."\nThe pink color on Lily's hair begins to fade.

Title: Cage of Love and Hatred
RoleContent: Do you like the color of my hair now?
EventDesc:
"I'm the avatar of authority, the servant of loyalty, the scourge of lovers."
"I'm the prophecy, and I'm its fulfillment."
"If you want the truth, you'll have to take the other half of the key from me."
Lily gently stands up and smiles at you seductively. Red Tide projections rush out from underneath her dress like an illusion.

Title: End of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: The Image of Love & Hatred falls before you, her twisted body dissolving into motes of data as her energy dissipates, and she gradually disappears.

Title: End of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: When the tide has subsided, you find a <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Hearts"</color> on the ground. Similar to the <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Spades"</color>, this card also emits powerful energy and computing power.

Title: End of Love and Hatred
EventDesc:
When you pick up the <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Hearts"</color>, you feel an excruciating pain in your head. Suddenly, strings of words appear in your mind.
"Head to the central area... Escape this place..."
You crouch down with your head in your arms until you finally comprehend the murmurs.
"Find the key that opens it."
<color=#b73a3a>"The visitor from the void will guide you..."</color>
The strange voice echoes in your heart, rousing you like an ancient prophecy.

Title: End of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: When you overlay the <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Spades"</color> with the <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Hearts"</color>, the light reveals a set of coordinates where the two cards overlap. Afterward, the two cards vanish instantly, turning into data and fading into a void crack that appears unnoticed.

Title: End of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: You decide to take a break and review your clues with Jetavie nearby.

Title: End of Love and Hatred
EventDesc: Desperate to escape the loop, you decide not to stay put, departing immediately.

Title: Court of Truth
EventDesc: Jetavie and you reach an enclosed maze. As you struggle to find the exit, a dark void crack appears behind you. You can just manage to see something glowing inside.

Title: Court of Truth
RoleContent: Is that the key to the door?
EventDesc: Right after you grab the "red key" from the void crack, the air is filled with a thick, blood-red mist. You notice a strange door standing amidst the crimson fog, and gray and black rays interweave and radiate around it.

Title: Court of Truth
EventDesc: You can see from afar the words "Door to the Truth" written on the door. As you eagerly reach out to touch it, a sharp metal pipe strikes you from beside you, forcing you away from the door. A familiar figure appears in the mist nearby—it is the man who lost his prosthetic arm and offered you his master's weapon.

Title: Court of Truth
EventDesc: "Long time no see! How are you doing?"\n"I'm so grateful you helped me defeat that troublesome swordsman!"\n"I'm sorry about hiding who I was before, but as the master's avatar... Well, I suppose we'll have to be enemies now."

Title: Court of Truth
RoleContent: I'm sorry, but this is the end of your journey. I can't let you get closer to that door.
EventDesc: The man lifts his remaining arm slightly, and a massive number of red data crystals appear in mid-air, converging at the man's hand.

Title: Court of Truth
RoleContent: Who knows? My mission is just to stop you. Surprises can happen.
EventDesc: With a smile, the man takes off his cape, and his figure is enlarged several times instantly.

Title: The Space Between Fates
EventDesc: Jetavie follows the clouds and the birds who are flying backward and arrives at the birthplace of all disasters and monsters. As time accelerates, a great number of monsters are constrained by the Red Tide.

Title: The Space Between Fates
RoleContent: We meet again. Have you gone wiser?
EventDesc: Without any hesitation, Jetavie steps into the battlefield that has brought chaos and new lives. Confronting countless monsters, she sends her gaze beyond them instead as she stares down the dark shadow hiding in the back...

Title: The Space Between Fates
RoleContent: I can't attack from afar, is that so...?
EventDesc: Jetavie pulls the trigger without hesitation, and the beam annihilates all the enemies before her. Still, the large figure in the shadow does not seem to be harmed.

Title: The Space Between Fates
RoleContent: There won't be a door here, understood?
EventDesc: Seeing the red key in Jetavie's hand, the Image of Wisdom looks satisfied. He waves his hand, and a dark void crack appears behind him. On the opposite side of the fissure are two familiar figures.

Title: The Space Between Fates
RoleContent: I hope you won't regret your choice.
EventDesc: Jetavie throws the key into the void crack. With a strange glow, the figures on the other side of the void jolt before the crack disappears.

Title: The Space Between Fates
RoleContent: It doesn't seem that you've gone wiser.
EventDesc: Unable to trust her enemy, Jetavie puts away the key.

Title: The Space Between Fates
RoleContent: It seems you're more brawn than brains.
EventDesc: Jetavie quickly closes in on the enemy. Before they can come face-to-face, the enemies lying in ambush jump out and attack, but Jetavie takes them out almost immediately.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Noticing the distorted space around her, Jetavie carefully walks along the twisting and crumbling ground until she encounters a warped figure. Alarmed, Jetavie raises her weapon, but she relaxes when the figure does not show any hostility.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: I'm a merchant who travels the void.
EventDesc: The merchant says he likes to collect all kinds of strange cards. If Jetavie has one, he is willing to trade it for something valuable.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Jetavie takes out the <color=#ff6767>"Queen of Spades"</color> she got from the Image of Desire. The merchant is very interested in the card and asks if Jetavie is willing to sell or lend it to him. The merchant promises her that he will return the card in the <color=#ff6767>"future"</color> to her untouched.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Jetavie rejects the merchant's request and departs the warped space.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: The merchant takes the card from Jetavie. After handing her a package, he leaves alongside the closing void crack.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: Not a bad deal. I look forward to your next visit.
EventDesc: Not knowing what the strange card does, Jetavie feels unsure. After a brief consideration, she decides to trade it with the merchant. He hands Jetavie a bag of supplies before leaving alongside the closing void crack.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Noticing the distorted space around her, Jetavie carefully walks along the twisting and crumbling ground until she encounters a warped figure. The void merchant seems to have been waiting for Jetavie here for a while.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: I don't recall having what you want.
EventDesc: The void merchant claims that he has a key item Jetavie is missing, and he is willing to exchange it for a rare card if Jetavie owns one.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Something strange has happened—two strange cards appear out of nowhere in Jetavie's pocket.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Jetavie hands him the two cards, and the merchant passes a red key to her. He claims that he retrieved it from a battlefield in another dimension, and it is also a byproduct of another key's mirror image.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: The price you paid isn't too bad.
EventDesc: Jetavie carefully hands him two <color=#ff6767>"Queen of Spades"</color>, and the void merchant gladly takes them after an inspection. To thank Jetavie, he offers a generous reward—a rare supply box he obtained from another dimension. He has never traded it away before, but he is willing to break the rules this time.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Jetavie rejects the merchant's request and departs the warped space.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Having completed the trade, the merchant departs alongside the closing void crack.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Noticing the distorted space around Jetavie and you, you carefully walk along the twisting and crumbling ground until you encounter a warped figure. He seems to have been waiting for you two here for a while.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: Who are you? I don't think we've met before.
EventDesc: The warped figure who calls himself the void merchant seems to know Jetavie, but Jetavie and you do not recall seeing him before.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: Fulfilling promises is the most important aspect of a business.
EventDesc: The void merchant claims that Jetavie once lent him a card, and he promised to return it in the "future." He has come to fulfill his part of the deal.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: The void merchant hands Jetavie the <color=#b73a3a>"Queen of Spades"</color>. Observing the card, you notice a large amount of strange energy contained inside.

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: The deal is complete. I'll head out first. Good luck.
EventDesc: Having returned the card, the void merchant departs alongside the closing void crack.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: You can feel how strange the card in the void merchant's hand is. Just to be safe, you decide to leave this warped space with Jetavie as quickly as possible.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: You take out the projector, catching the void merchant's attention. After a close inspection, he frowns and explains that this device isn't fully unlocked yet. Right now, it can only be used for "observation", not real "travel".

Title: Void Merchant
RoleContent: Don't sweat it. Consider it interest for borrowing your card.
EventDesc: You ask the merchant if he can modify the machine. He activates the card, merges it with the projector, and restores its full functionality before handing it back to you.

Title: Void Merchant
EventDesc: Before leaving, the merchant warns you: Never let the Void Watcher catch you traveling through time. If they do, it won't end well.

Title: Uninvited Guest
EventDesc: Jetavie pushes open a mysterious door hiding in the dark and finds two humans fighting against a monster swordsman. The two are working in unison like master and student.

Title: Uninvited Guest
EventDesc: Unfortunately, the old man in the front quickly falls due to the difference in strength, and the young man supporting him at the back is about to be devoured by the monster.

Title: Uninvited Guest
RoleContent: You should watch out in the future, rulebreaker.
EventDesc: Jetavie suddenly fires at the monster. Surprised, the monster is pierced by the beam and retreats hastily, wounded. In the end, Jetavie saves the injured man.

Title: Uninvited Guest
EventDesc: The young man's prosthetic arm was eaten by the monster, but he is only slightly injured otherwise. To thank Jetavie for her help, he hands her his unused supply box.

Title: Uninvited Guest
RoleContent: To participate in a fair fight is an honor.
EventDesc: The monster swordsman accepts Jetavie's invitation and wagers the young man's life. If Jetavie wins the fight, it will let the man go.

Title: Uninvited Guest
