EventDesc: Jetavie uses [Ambush], and the monster falls to the beam before it can react. After taking away the monster's sword, Jetavie leaves behind some supplies for the injured young man before departing.

Title: Uninvited Guest
EventDesc: Jetavie uses [Ambush], but the monster's sharp senses quickly figure out her moves and it avoids her attack. Enraged by Jetavie's actions, the monster raises its sword and strikes at her.

Title: Uninvited Guest
EventDesc: To make this a fair fight, Jetavie waits until the enemy is prepared before attacking.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: Jetavie arrives at a facility before doors labeled [Zero] to [Ten]. The gate keeper is asking Jetavie to choose a door randomly.

Title: Multiple Doors
RoleContent: Now that you've made a choice, it is time to pay the price.
EventDesc: Jetavie walks straight through Door Three, but there is nothing inside. As she is about to leave, she finds the door locked by the gate keeper from the outside. He is asking her to hand in some chips before he lets her out.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: Jetavie promises to hand in the chip, and the gate keeper opens the door for her.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: Jetavie raises her weapon and blows up the door. Enraged, the gate keeper charges at her.

Title: Multiple Doors
RoleContent: If you want to take it with you, you'll need to pay the price.
EventDesc: Jetavie retrieves a strange weapon from Door Seven. The gate keeper will not let her take it away unless she leaves behind some chips.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: Jetavie leaves behind some chips and takes the weapon away.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: Jetavie rejects the gate keeper's request, leaving behind the weapon and departing.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: When Jetavie enters Door Nine, she finds a large monster chained up inside. It looks hideous, and saliva is dripping down its toothy maw. It begs Jetavie to sever the chains.

Title: Multiple Doors
RoleContent: What's the use of this thing...
EventDesc: To thank Jetavie, the monster leaves behind a strange front tooth before smashing open the door and escaping into the void crack.

Title: Multiple Doors
EventDesc: Considering how dangerous it can be, Jetavie rejects the monster's request. It snarls at her angrily for half a day until she finally leaves Room Nine.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie encounters a pair of twins in the woods. They are playing hide-and-seek and invite Jetavie to join them. The sister asks Jetavie to close her eyes and count down from ten.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: Halfway through counting, Jetive hears a low growl coming from behind.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: A group of wild wolves appears behind Jetavie. She aims her gun toward the wolf king, but she worries that she may hit the twins hiding behind the tree.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie fires at the sky, and all the beasts and birds in the woods scatter at the sound of the loud explosion and the red light. The twins that were playing hide-and-seek with Jetavie are nowhere to be found. The sudden gunshot might have scared them away.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: The wolf pack is also scared off. Tracing their trail, Jetavie finds some supplies in their lair.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie puts her gun away cautiously, and the wolves stop approaching and leave. Jetavie quickly finds the brother and places him safely in an orphanage nearby. Briefly resupplied, she heads out again to search for the sister.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie finally finds the sister observing insects deep in the woods. She brings the girl back to the orphanage safely.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: Jetavie hears the boy scream as soon as she finishes counting. She rushes toward the sound and finds a pack of wild wolves biting down on the boy's leg. Desperate, Jetavie fires at the wolves. The burning ray disintegrates the beasts, and they leave behind a silver wolf talisman.

Title: Children's Game
EventDesc: The boy does not seem to be injured. After asking him, she finds out that the wolves were just trying to remove the thorns he was ensnared in.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: Darkness has covered the night sky. Jetavie is traveling through the ruined structures by herself when a red-glowing pendulum within some dilapidated walls draws her attention. The pendulum looks very out of place.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: Jetavie finds a note on the pendulum. She cannot help but read what is written on it—\n"Do you want to bring some colors to the world? Wind me up."

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: Jetavie winds up the clockwork, and the sky is immediately covered by a sea of red codes. They fly past like aurora and quickly disappear.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: Slightly confused, Jetavie leaves the stopped pendulum behind.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: The note sounds like a prophecy. Alarmed, Jetavie quickly leaves the place.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: Darkness has covered the night sky. Jetavie and you are traveling through a ruined orphanage and eerie cemetery when you find a blue-glowing pendulum in the bushes. The pendulum looks very out of place.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: You find a note on the pendulum. You cannot help but read what is written on it—\n"Do you want to bring some colors to the world? Wind me up."

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: You wind up the clockwork, and the sky is immediately covered by a sea of blue codes. They fly past like aurora and quickly disappear.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: Slightly confused, Jetavie and you leave the stopped pendulum behind.

Title: Paused Pendulum
EventDesc: The note sounds like a prophecy. Worried, Jetavie and you quickly leave the place.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: An eerie green flame passes by you when Jetavie and you walk past a secluded mansion, and Jetavie screams.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: At the same time, a strange time-space fluctuation appears inside the mansion. You can sense a powerful energy within.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
RoleContent: Something seems to be missing here.
EventDesc: Jetavie and you enter the mansion, trying to approach the source of the warped space. As you take a step on the stairs, you notice a fox statue in the attic corridor glistening in silver. Suspicious, you observe carefully and notice the fox is missing its tail, which serves as the base of the statue. Jetavie suggests that you might fill the empty space with something...

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: You have found a luminous pearl and a strange gem.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: The fox statue shakes clunkily, and its stone mouth spits out a pile of chips.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: The fox statue shakes clunkily, and its stone mouth spits out a supply box.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: Jetavie and you chase after the ghostly flame, and you quickly get lost in the woods. Right then, you decide to...

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: Unfortunately, it is cloudy tonight, and the moon is hidden away. You keep walking, and you do not realize you have strayed from your original path until sunrise.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: Following the faint reflection of the silver dial in the mansion, you quickly discover the path of the ghostly flame and locate it—it is a small, glowing fox.

Title: Mystery of the Night Flame
EventDesc: When your finger touches the small fox, it quickly turns into a smooth, lustrous fox-shaped jade.

Title: Crystalline Feather
EventDesc: You climb to the top of the spire and find a flaming bird at the highest point. You also find a titanium compound bow in an armory nearby, with which you can shoot down the flaming bird if you want.

Title: Crystalline Feather
EventDesc: You take the compound bow and fire an iron arrow at the flaming bird, but, to your surprise, the arrow disintegrates into gray powder as it nears the flame. Startled by your attack, the flaming bird quickly flees the spire.

Title: Crystalline Feather
EventDesc: Jetavie found some fried chicken drumsticks and fancy foie gras, but you know those are useless to you. You suspect that Jetavie just offered you her leftovers.

Title: Crystalline Feather
EventDesc: You find a jade lute in the music room. Luckily, you know how to read a musical score, so you take the dusty sheets to the top of the spire and play the tune its master had played countless times. As expected, the flaming bird slowly approaches you and douses the fire on itself before staying by the iron fence.

Title: Crystalline Feather
EventDesc: You fire an unexpected arrow, surprising the now-flameless bird and killing it. As it disappears, it leaves behind some data crystals.

Title: Crystalline Feather
EventDesc: You stay and admire the beautiful flaming bird. Realizing that you are not an enemy, it leaves behind its feather as a gift to thank you for playing music for it.

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: You arrive at an empty amphitheater that used to be a coliseum where gladiators fought. The scent of violence and blood rushes out the moment Jetavie opens the door, and you can almost hear the screams that have lasted millenniums. The malice of the dead is slowly rising as if Jetavie and you are being treated as new challengers...

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: Before the malice can reach you, you immediately escape this eerie theater. But then you find out that Jetavie is gone!

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: You find Jetavie running toward you after grabbing the gem from the seats of the coliseum. She has not noticed the red mist behind her, and you close the door to the arena before it catches up to both of you.

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: You head to the center of the coliseum, and large openings appear on the floor before you. A large amount of red slime gushes out from underground, accompanied by a moth-like figure.

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: You dodge the mothman's attack, but the white figure has blocked your way out. Facing it, you can tell that the monster before you has slayed countless challengers. Without hesitation, you walk up to it and declare your name. You know that a fight is inevitable.

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: You use [Ambush] and quickly defeat the monster by working together with Jetavie. After its body disappears, a strange carcass is left behind on the ground.

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: You use [Ambush], but the monster quickly figures out your intentions. It flies up and appears even more threatening.

Title: Hell Angel
EventDesc: Before the monster strikes, you target its weakness and fight back.

Title: Truth of the Hero
EventDesc: Jetavie enters the bottom floor of the building and instantly senses something strange. She raises her weapon, inspecting her surroundings carefully.

Title: Truth of the Hero
EventDesc: Indeed, a group of cultists quickly surround her. Behind the crazed figures is a strange altar on which a girl in white lies.

Title: Truth of the Hero
EventDesc: Jetavie flawlessly takes out the cultists surrounding her, but her beam accidentally hits a stone pillar during the battle. The ceiling collapses, crushing the altar. Jetavie rushes toward the girl, but she has already stopped breathing.

Title: Truth of the Hero
RoleContent: I'm sorry. The calculation seems to be wrong...
EventDesc: Jetavie takes a deep breath and ponders briefly before burying the girl in a nearby field.

Title: Truth of the Hero
EventDesc: Jetavie puts away her weapon and breaks through the cultists with close-range attacks, saving the girl just in time. Witnessing this, all the cultists suddenly kneel before her, seemingly treating the powerful Jetavie as some kind of fallen angel and the girl as their reincarnated leader.

Title: Truth of the Hero
EventDesc: Jetavie safely takes the girl away from the bottom floor of the building. On her way back, she encounters the girl's father, who is looking for her. To show his gratitude, the father offers Jetavie a gift.

Title: Truth of the Hero
EventDesc: This place is dangerous. Just to be safe, Jetavie decides to make the girl the cultist leader so that the cultists will protect the girl. To thank Jetavie, the "fallen angel," the cultists have prepared some gifts for her.

Title: Truth of the Stars
EventDesc: Jetavie enters an observatory and is immediately attacked by the robot inside. "Invaders detected!" the robot screams.

Title: Truth of the Stars
EventDesc: Jetavie notices the label [Stargazer A] on the robot. She concludes that it is not a combat model and it has not been infected by the Red Tide.

Title: Truth of the Stars
EventDesc: The robot's chip has seemingly been burned. Although its core stargazing module still works, the module that controls its action has completely malfunctioned.

Title: Truth of the Stars
EventDesc: Jetavie cannot find a suitable chip, so she swaps it with an old, mass-produced one. The robot soon calms down and offers her a supply box as a thank you.

Title: Truth of the Stars
EventDesc: After Jetavie removes the core parts of the robot's damaged chip, it immediately stops moving.

Title: Truth of the Stars
EventDesc: As Jetavie inspects the observatory's system, she accidentally activates the star projector. The starry night sky momentarily calms down the violent robot.

Title: Truth of the Memories
EventDesc: When Jetavie walks past a dark alley, a refugee in ragged clothes comes up and hugs her leg.

Title: Truth of the Memories
EventDesc: The refugee explains that he is being chased by a group of monsters. If Jetavie does not help him, he may die soon.

Title: Truth of the Memories
EventDesc: Jetavie fires a few times and easily destroys the pursuing monsters. Impressed by her terrifying power, the refugee asks Jetavie to keep him safe.

Title: Truth of the Memories
RoleContent: You won't live long if you always depend on others.
EventDesc: Jetavie does not have time to help the refugee deal with other potential monsters, so she leaves him a weapon box.

Title: Truth of the Memories
RoleContent: I see... Then... please take this. Thank you for your help.
EventDesc: Although Jetavie rejects him, he still takes out a supply box from his limited supplies to thank her for her assistance.

Title: Truth of the Memories
EventDesc: Jetavie does not want to waste her time fighting monsters, so she leaves the refugee behind. Soon, she hears a scream, and she feels kind of guilty.

Title: Daughter of the Tree God
RoleContent: This is a blessing! This is god's will!
EventDesc: Jetavie encounters a girl obsessed with a giant tree in the strange space. The girl seems to be in some kind of euphoria, and she is yelling and praying nonstop stubbornly.

Title: Daughter of the Tree God
RoleContent: This blessing must be the god of the trees! Hahahahaha...
EventDesc: Jetavie raises her weapon, and a red bean easily pierces the giant tree. A large number of computing crystals spills out of the tree, shocking the girl. Unable to accept the death of the tree god, she blinds herself and claims she has received the god's blessings.

Title: Daughter of the Tree God
EventDesc: Jetavie bandages the girl, and in exchange, the girl prays to the god of the trees for forgiveness.

Title: Daughter of the Tree God
EventDesc: The girl's faith in the god of the trees is unwavering, and she refuses to listen to Jetavie's words. To lure Jetavie into joining her church, the girl even gives her some supplies. But Jetavie still rejects her offer, and the girl is greatly displeased.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie falls into a ventilation shaft while she is searching for a wartime supply depot nearby. In the dark tunnels, she discovers a giant rat.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie offers the giant rat some food, but it does not look that hungry. She can tell it is quite full from its size, but the kind rat still takes Jetavie back to its treasure trove.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie takes the supplies the giant rat shares with her before finding the exit to escape the shaft with its help.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: The giant rat runs away in fear. Following its footsteps, Jetavie finally finds the exit and escapes.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie tries to communicate with the giant rat. It seems to understand her words, turning around and nodding to motion Jetavie to follow it.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Guided by the giant rat, Jetavie arrives at a supply depot, which is right underneath the exit to the outside.

Title: Escape Unscathed
EventDesc: Jetavie retrieves some useful supplies and rewards the rat with a piece of cheese. The rat does not seem interested, however, and turns around and leaves.

Title: Story of the Chosen One
EventDesc: The eerie howling of the night winds and the distant wails of wild animals bring Jetavie to a halt in her tracks. She decides to take a break before dawn.

Title: Story of the Chosen One
EventDesc: Before she sleeps, Jetavie flips open her diary, reading up on the events of the past few days.

Title: Story of the Chosen One
EventDesc: A long, long time ago, the Chosen One woke up in the pure-white room. Despite not knowing about this world, the Chosen decided to believe me. Our journey began, then, and I no longer needed to face the monsters alone.

Title: Story of the Chosen One
EventDesc: Many cycles ago, the Chosen One got tired of the endless loop. Realizing that the two of us were the two parts of the same being, the Chosen One made the sacrifice to help me escape. I gained all the Chosen One's computing power, but I didn't manage to awake. Despite having gotten more powerful, I lost a precious companion.

Title: Story of the Chosen One
EventDesc: No matter what, the past cannot be changed. Time should be spent to prepare for dangers before they arrive.

Title: Story of the Chosen One
EventDesc: The night sky darkens. Conflicted, Jetavie closes her diary and closes her eyes.

Title: Weapon Technician
EventDesc: In a place resembling a children's play area, Jetavie finds a game console she can program. As the state-of-the-art product in the laboratory, the console uses a non-invasive port. It is still in development and has not been mass-produced.

Title: Weapon Technician
EventDesc: Connecting to the machine, Jetavie plays a few games of mazes and tetris, easily beating the previous records and gaining the computing chip reward.

Title: Weapon Technician
EventDesc: Jetavie enters her combat data into a minigame and sets up some map data of different battlefields. She does not know if anyone else will connect to this console in the future, but she hopes the precious data can be a good reference for those who come after her.

Title: Weapon Technician
EventDesc: After she finishes programming, Jetavie receives a thank-you note and some rewards from the console AI.

Title: Deadly Hazard
RoleContent: Not yet. Just a little bit more.
EventDesc: In a laboratory on the surface, Jetavie discovers two infected monsters trying to attack a scientist who is deep in his research.

Title: Deadly Hazard
EventDesc: After some consideration, Jetavie shoots down the two monsters. The scientist is distracted by the sudden gunshot, and the nuclear reactor in his hand collapses in a blinding flash. Jetavie is not harmed by the radiation, but the human scientist is lethally poisoned. He stares at Jetavie, shocked, as if seeing the grim reaper.

Title: Deadly Hazard
RoleContent: There's still a chance. I need to upload it to the terminal...
EventDesc: Jetavie finds some iodine tablets in a first aid kit in a corner, but the scientist knows it is too late. He asks Jetavie to use the server terminal to upload the data.

Title: Deadly Hazard
EventDesc: After the last data is uploaded, Jetavie returns to the lab and finds the scientist's lifeless body with some chips in his open palm. They seem to be his gift to thank Jetavie for helping him.

Title: Deadly Hazard
RoleContent: This will prove my worth! Please keep quiet.
EventDesc: The scientist tells Jetavie that he is currently building a nuclear reactor. Hearing that, Jetavie cautiously avoids attacking the Corrupted right away. Instead, she draws them out of the room first before taking them down.

Title: Deadly Hazard
RoleContent: At least wear a protective suit next time...
EventDesc: The scientist thanks Jetavie for not interrupting his work and offers her some supplies as a farewell gift.

Title: Corruption Scandal
RoleContent: I think there are suspicious people monitoring this place.
EventDesc: Jetavie encounters a researcher in an unnamed archive. He has been receiving anonymous death threats for exposing how his colleagues have been embellishing research materials. Seeing the powerful weapons Jetavie carries, the researcher asks her to stay and protect him for a while.

Title: Corruption Scandal
RoleContent: There's no such thing as a free lunch.
EventDesc: The researcher cannot afford to pay Jetavie properly. He has been funding his research with his own money, so he has nothing left anymore. Jetavie does not want to waste her time on something that has no benefit, so she leaves the research behind and departs the archive.

Title: Corruption Scandal
RoleContent: Don't let me see you again. Otherwise...
EventDesc: After leaving the archive, Jetavie catches some scouts hiding nearby. She teaches them a lesson and takes away their wallets and IDs so they will leave the researcher alone.

Title: Corruption Scandal
EventDesc: Jetavie rejects her request, but the scientist asks Jetavie to help her do one last thing for her—transferring some expensive research materials to a safe basement. Jetavie agrees, and the researcher hands Jetavie her remaining chips in return.

Title: Industrial Ghost
EventDesc: Jetavie pushes open the thick metal door of the incomplete venue. Red Tide has invaded here, and many infected industrial machines are targeting the lone guide robot.

Title: Industrial Ghost
EventDesc: Jetavie fires her weapon, and the red beam completely disintegrates all the active Corrupted in the venue.

Title: Industrial Ghost
RoleContent: Thank you for your help, Guest FW54dsa.
EventDesc: The guide robot thanks Jetavie for her help. In exchange, it offers her a weapon box.

Title: Industrial Ghost
EventDesc: After retrieving some useful parts from the bodies of the hideous Corrupted, Jetavie carefully crosses the fuel-covered floor and leaves.

Title: Industrial Ghost
RoleContent: Preying on your own kind. How pathetic.
EventDesc: A beam of red light flashes, and all the machines are destroyed alongside the venue. Before it collapses on her, Jetavie turns around and leaves.

Title: Jetavie's Battle
RoleContent: How about a one-on-one? Whatever. It doesn't matter.
EventDesc: When Jetavie passes a scary courtyard during her journey, a large number of creepy puppets appear from the shadows. All of them are infected mechanoids that are going after Jetavie for some reason.

Title: Jetavie's Battle
EventDesc: The bear puppet charges at Jetavie, but she punches through its chest and pulls out its core from its body.

Title: Jetavie's Battle
EventDesc: Without an energy supply, the bear puppet falls to the ground, and the rest of the puppets also stop. Jetavie takes the core and leaves the courtyard.

Title: Jetavie's Battle
RoleContent: A bigger weapon isn't necessarily better.
EventDesc: The nurse automaton swings its scissors and charges at Jetavie, but she shatters its knee with a kick. Having broken the enemy's left leg, Jetavie grabs its scissors and jams them into its brain.

Title: Jetavie's Battle
EventDesc: After Jetavie pulls out the scissors, gasoline spills out of the nurse automaton's head, and its slender figure falls to the ground.

Title: Jetavie's Battle
EventDesc: A giant dinosaur model appears behind Jetavie and opens its gaping maw. Jetavie fires at the monster, and the red beam turns it into dust.

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: Jetavie finds a gold-plated key in a dark room in a mansion, but the key does not open any door.

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: Curious, Jetavie searches every corner of the mansion thoroughly, finally finding a hidden clue on the corner of an oil painting.\n"Dear customer, there are treasures hidden in the garden and the books..."

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: Cornflowers grow abundantly in the garden. When she waters them, she accidentally finds an intricate treasure chest in the wet soil.

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: Jetavie finds a hidden groove in a corner of the library. After she inserts the key, an opening appears between two shelves. Entering it, she finds the metal door and the combination lock inside.

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: The passcode is clearly wrong. The metal door does not move, and Jetavie leaves the study disappointed.

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: Somehow, a series of numbers appears in Jetavie's mind. She enters the code and opens the secret chamber.

Title: Ten Thousand Gold
EventDesc: The chamber is filled with gold and jewelry. Jetavie ponders briefly before taking the most valuable-looking piece of jewelry and leaving.

Title: Midway Stash
EventDesc: A large, wild pitcher plant Jetavie encounters on her journey tries to attack her, threatening her with its two pitchers.

Title: Midway Stash
EventDesc: After the large pitcher of the pitcher plant is punctured by the beam, the supplies stored inside spill out like trash.

Title: Midway Stash
EventDesc: After the small pitcher of the pitcher plant is punctured by the beam, the supplies stored inside spill out like trash.

Title: Midway Stash
EventDesc: After the pitcher plant is punctured, one of its pitchers bursts open, dropping a black metal box.

Title: Midway Stash
EventDesc: After the pitcher plant is punctured, one of its pitchers bursts open, dropping a normal package.

Title: Midway Stash
EventDesc: After the pitcher plant is punctured, one of its pitchers bursts open, dropping a rare package.

Title: Walking Into a Trap
RoleContent: Money's been tight lately. Mind lending me some money, girlie?
EventDesc: Jetavie encounters a large, angry bandit during her journey. Seeing how small Jetavie looks, he tries to rob her.

Title: Walking Into a Trap
EventDesc: Seeing the terrifying beam, the bandit immediately puts his hands up to surrender. Jetavie walks up and holds her gun to his head.

Title: Walking Into a Trap
EventDesc: Jetavie takes away the supplies the bandit plundered and leaves the crying man behind.

Title: Walking Into a Trap
EventDesc: Jetavie forces the bandit to take her back to his base, and she takes down his whole crew. She takes all the supplies they plundered before leaving.

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: Jetavie stands before an eerie black door, where a girl who calls herself a disciple stands outside. She warns Jetavie not to approach her leader's altar.

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: Ignoring the disciple's warning, Jetavie pushes open the black door and hears the scream of something non-human. A revolting altar sits in the middle of the red-slime-covered chamber, above which an unspeakable horror is placed. And there is no leader in this repulsive space.

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: Jetavie places a chip on the altar, but nothing happens. She places a spare weapon box on it, and the flesh on the altar begins to wriggle before spitting out an eyeball from the stinking sack. Jetavie feels extremely uncomfortable.

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: Jetavie takes the eyeball despite how sick it makes her feel. She believes that it is going to be useful in the future.

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: After she pulls the trigger, the scorching ray instantly destroys the altar. Staring at the white smoke, Jetavie frowns as she realizes that this is not her first time destroying an altar. Suddenly, she hears the cry of a monster from the smoke as something large charges at her...

Title: Sisyphus
EventDesc: Jetavie asks the girl the reason she is guarding the door, and the girl who claims to be a disciple tells Jetavie how her parents were hunted by the monster inside. Hearing this, Jetavie promises to keep the girl safe and manages to convince the girl to leave with her.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Jetavie finds a spiral staircase underground and climbs up, but she always ends up where she started no matter how hard she tries.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Eventually, Jetavie finds out what is strange about the spiral staircase—the higher she goes, the more mind-interfering markers are placed, and her visual module has been accessed abnormally multiple times. She is almost certain that this is a trap.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Jetavie takes out her weapon and fires at the source of the signal. As the hologram distorts, the mechanoids in camouflage are blown up in pieces, and the fire fully dissipates the projection. The spiral staircase turns into featureless ruins and loses its charm.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Found a strobe light in the mechanoid's remains.

Title: Mobius
EventDesc: Jetavie keeps climbing the stairs quietly. Meanwhile, she has been hacking into their control system, and she discovers that the mechanoid has been hacked long ago after a close inspection. The crucial backdoor lies inside the mainframe of the mechanoid.

Title: Mobius
RoleContent: This eye is not what it seems...
EventDesc: Jetavie carefully retrieves an "eyeball" from the mechanoid's mainframe. The eyeball is not a chip, but the strange energy inside was what caused the mechanoid's logic to go haywire and allowed it to set up a trap that was beyond its capability.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Jetavie steps foot in an eerie corridor inside the neuroscience research center. Multiple copies of Renaissance masterpieces decorate the wall, and the beautiful chandeliers and wallpaper make this place look like a museum instead of a laboratory.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Following the corridor, Jetavie returns to the large oil painting at the beginning after some time. She tries again, but she ends up at the start again.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Jestavie admires the large oil painting next to her which depicts a young nun who has lost her mind due to her fanatical devotion. Pouring mercury into her eyes, the nun looks lifeless with her empty pupils despite her beautiful face.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Jetavie takes out two eyeballs and places them in the recesses of the painting. Suddenly, the space around Jetavie warps in a terrifying way, and the twisted figure of the "nun?" rushes forward from behind the painting.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Jetavie tears down the large painting of the nun. For a moment, she seems to hear the painting scream, which terrifies her.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: A toolbox is hidden behind the oil painting. It is a device that can play sound in a special wavelength, which interferes with the mind. Jetavie turns the device off and retrieves the valuable metal parts inside.

Title: Endless Corridor
RoleContent: This place is a little strange.
EventDesc: A red beam completely destroys the corridor before her and the many oil paintings inside. The space warps and distorts before reverting to its original form—a circular testing ground.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: According to the research log of the circular testing ground, this used to be a psychiatric hospital before being transformed into a mental-interference research venue. The test subjects were all patients of the hospital who "volunteered". After a quick search, Jetavie finds a weapon box nearby that was prepared in case the test subjects got violent.

Title: Endless Corridor
EventDesc: Jetavie falls asleep where she is. When she wakes up, her body and her soul have both left the eerie corridor.

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: Before a temple, Jetavie witnesses a group of black-clad figures climbing up the vines with a weapon in hand to infiltrate the temple from the back.

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: Jetavie can hear strange hymns coming out of the temple continuously. Since the situations on both sides are unusual, Jetavie decides to hide in a corner for now until she comes up with a plan.

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: Jetavie helps the people in black climb up to the top of the temple. They hand Jetavie a weapon before everyone shouts "Destroy the heretics!" and jumps down the roof to fight the mechanoids in the temple. Before Jetavie realizes it, a few mechanoids are already charging at her.

Title: Temple War
RoleContent: The abyss calls! The great conquest has arrived!
EventDesc: After defeating a few mechanoids, the black-clad figures have gained the upper hand. Eventually, they chase the mechanoids out of the temple and destroy the statue of the machine god the mechanoids were worshipping. They replace it with an unspeakable horror...

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: After shouting their slogans with them, Jetavie is proclaimed the "abyss angel" by the black-clad figures. They call her the "all-powerful demon warrior" and, to reward her contributions during the battle, gift her the dagger used to kill the heretics.

Title: Temple War
RoleContent: Violence is not the best solution.
EventDesc: Jetavie fires a beam at the top of the temple, and the two groups in combat immediately quiet down. She calmly looks at all of them and requests them to hand in their weapons, or she will destroy the whole temple. As expected, both the mechanoids and the black-clad figures give up their weapons without a fight.

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: A few mechanoids are singing in a circle inside the temple. Seeing Jetavie break in, they charge toward her and scream "Eliminate the heretics!" with their stiff, synthetic voices.

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: Jetavie leaves the temple understandingly, and the mechanoids stop pursuing her.

Title: Temple War
EventDesc: The beam disintegrates the attacking mechanoids, but it is so powerful that it also destroys the stone pillar that is supporting the temple. The figures in black on the vines fall down one after another and scream in pain. Their leader immediately gives up their weapons and asks Jetive to spare them.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: When she walks past a dense forest, Jetavie notices sparks of flame among the trees. As she approaches, she notices a group of figures in black performing a cultist ritual. Suddenly, the sheep they were planning to sacrifice freaks out and breaks free, knocking down multiple cultists as it runs toward Jetavie.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: Jetavie keeps the sheep behind her to protect it. The cultists surround her and ask her to give it up, or they will teach her a lesson.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: Jetavie takes out some chips and offers to buy the sheep, but the cultists are still undecided. Only when she takes out her weapon that they agree to the trade before leaving while grumbling.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: There is a bump in the sheep's stomach, and Jetavie guesses that it must be the reason why it freaked out earlier—it swallowed something that gave it a terrible stomach ache. After Jetavie helps the sheep vomit, it spits out a strange weapon box.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: The figures in black still charge at Jetavie even after she takes out her weapon, so she fires at the sky. Afterward, both the cultists and the sheep run away.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: Jetavie recovers some supplies from the camp abandoned by the cultists. Hearing a beast roaring in the woods, Jetavie quickly exits the dark forest before the cultists' reinforcement arrives.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: Jetavie catches the sheep and hands it to the cultists. The one leading the group asks Jetavie if she is a servant of Eden or the Serpent.

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: Hearing her answer, the cultists are irritated and send Jetavie away. She departs with a long face...

Title: Festival Travel Notes
EventDesc: After hearing her answer, the cultists confirm Jetavie's identity as a demon worshipper. They offer her a gift—a nail that once pierced a heretic.

Title: Cult of the Abyss
EventDesc: A sense of absurdity covers this sunless land. Jetavie follows the crazed cultists to their lair—the Church of Abyss underground.

Title: Cult of the Abyss
EventDesc: The cultist leader in a black robe welcomes Jetavie and hopes to hold an initiation ceremony for her...

Title: Cult of the Abyss
EventDesc: Jetavie accepts the cultist leader's request. However, he requests her to show him the two tokens first.

Title: Cult of the Abyss
RoleContent: Destroying humanity is the proof of your faith.
EventDesc: The cultist leader is satisfied after Jetavie shows him the "dagger" and the "nail". He takes Jetavie to a secret chamber where a pair of nomad mother and daughter are tied up inside. He asks Jetavie to kill the two as a sacrifice—this is the initiation.

Title: Cult of the Abyss
EventDesc: Jetavie strikes the cultist leader with her elbow when he turns away, but he is not injured at all. He calmly takes off his coat and reveals fully mechanical parts.

Title: Cult of the Abyss
EventDesc: Jetavie does not hand in the so-called "tokens" and angers the cultist leader. He orders his underlings to surround her, but a red beam flashes and destroys all the mechanical cultists in Jetavie's way. She turns and leaves, leaving the cultist leader surprised.

Title: Forbidden Experiment
EventDesc: Jetavie enters a laboratory and finds it covered in blood. Worried, she decides to hide in the shadows.

Title: Forbidden Experiment
EventDesc: Two children run past Jetavie, being chased by a monster. The hideous-looking monster seems extremely dangerous.

Title: Forbidden Experiment
RoleContent: That didn't kill you, huh? Well, then...
EventDesc: A red beam melts a giant hole in the monster's body from behind. However, the monster does not fall, and its body quickly regenerates. Having recovered, it turns around and charges at Jetavie with its gaping maw.

Title: Forbidden Experiment
EventDesc: Charged with more computing power, the beam weapon fires and instantly fills the space with red light, annihilating the monster and half of the laboratory. After it dies, the gray-haired boy steps out, shaking and handing a faded note to Jetavie before running away.

Title: Forbidden Experiment
EventDesc: "The Void Messenger delivers a vision of opulence."\n\n—Unknown Gospel I

Title: Forbidden Experiment
EventDesc: The monster knocks down the two children, cornering them. Desperate, the purple-haired girl suddenly injects some kind of serum into herself and turns into a "demihuman," defeating the monster with her superhuman physique.

Title: Forbidden Experiment
EventDesc: Jetavie walks up and tries to communicate with the demihuman girl, but the girl goes on a rampage instead, like she has lost her mind. Eventually, the girl escapes the laboratory, leaving the gray-haired boy behind, who immediately chases after her. Overwhelmed, Jetavie stays behind and collects some blood samples from the monster's remains.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: In a corner of the orphanage, the gray-haired boy is holding the wounded demihuman girl tightly, who has passed out after her rampage. The boy asks Jetavie to help turn the girl back to normal, and he says Jetavie will receive an important insight if she offers her assistance.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Saving the girl, however, might require making an antidote from a serum sample of the virus.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Jetavie has the gray-haired boy and the demihuman girl stay put before heading to a nearby laboratory alone. It used to be a multinational pharmaceutical company that has ceased operating, but a female researcher still works inside. Jetavie asks her to analyze the virus and create an antidote.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Although Jetavie is confused about how the woman came up with an antidote for such a horrifying virus in such a short time, there is no other way. She can only trust the woman right now.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Jetavie injects the test antidote into the demihuman girl, and she does recover. To thank Jetavie, the gray-haired boy takes out a museum staff ID he took from a mysterious woman.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: After checking the address recorded on it, Jetavie is unsure when she has been there. Perhaps it is a good idea to investigate the place.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Jetavie leaves behind a butterfly knife and looks at the desperate boy coldly, awaiting him to accept the cruel fate.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: The boy takes the butterfly knife, but he does not hurt the demihuman girl. Instead, he leaves behind a faded note for Jetavie before leaving with the girl.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: In the twilight of love and enmity lie veiled shards of hope.\n\n—Unknown Gospel II

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: Jetavie tries to make the antidote herself, but without any reference, she can only put together some medicines she has taken from the orphanage's first-aid kit that match the symptoms.

Title: Demihuman Girl
EventDesc: The demihuman girl takes the pills, but they are clearly ineffective, only helping her breathe more easily. To thank Jetavie's help, the boy offers her some supplies.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: Jetavie arrives at a strange museum in the mist. Although it looks suspicious, Jetavie has never been here before. She decides to investigate it.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: Opening the door to the sculpture area, Jetavie does not find anything unusual in there apart from a statue of David that does not look quite right.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The left eye of David seems to have been replaced with a capsule. Jetavie takes the capsule and finds a faded note inside the eye socket.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: Opening the gate of truth demands experiencing, enduring, and recovering from its depths.\n\n—Unknown Gospel III

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: Heading toward the corridor with all the beautiful paintings, Jetavie finds a woman sketching at the end in front of a glass window. Jetavie approaches her carefully, but the hooded woman seems to have noticed her a long time ago. She puts down her pen and turns her canvas toward Jetavie.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The canvas depicts a scene where Jetavie raises her gun and battles a hideous monster.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: A large monster suddenly appears where Jetavie has walked past and charges at her.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The scenery around her starts to change. The gallery and the woman become more and more distant.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: Considering how likely they will bring down the building by fighting in such small spaces, Jetavie uses the staff ID to activate the escalator to the top floor and avoids a direct conflict with the monster.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: After entering a safe area, Jetavie is surprised to find a note written in blood on the wall.

Title: False Reality
EventDesc: The Unknown Gospel is a deceptive tome that steers one toward Hell.\n\n—Unknown Gospel IV

Title: Chessboard Puzzle
EventDesc: Jetavie accidentally barges into a group of large chess pieces. The black and white figures seem to be glistening silver under the night sky.

Title: Chessboard Puzzle
EventDesc: A strange girl stands on the other side of the chessboard and shouts at Jetavie, hoping to play a game of chess with her.

Title: Chessboard Puzzle
EventDesc: Jetavie is going to move the pieces herself when she realizes they move automatically if she just thinks about it. Falling into an unfavorable position not long after the game has started, Jetavie eventually loses.

Title: Chessboard Puzzle
RoleContent: A fool is always a fool.
EventDesc: The girl keeps saying how bored she is and asks Jetavie to come back after Jetavie has gotten some practice, and she will offer Jetavie some rewards if she wins. Afterward, the girl throws Jetavie a bag of chips before kicking her out.

Title: Chessboard Puzzle
RoleContent: Hey! Why are you suddenly so angry?
EventDesc: Jetavie rejects the girl's invitation since she thinks it is exhausting to use her brain. This move angers the girl, and she charges at Jetavie all of a sudden.

Title: Mirror World
EventDesc: Walking into a room covered in mirrors, Jetavie hears wind blowing from the other side of the mirrors. Before she can react, she falls into the mirror world—a dimension made of prismatic crystals. On the opposite end of the crystals is a frozen throne where a girl sits.

Title: Mirror World
EventDesc: The girl is studying a chess endgame. She is so focused that she does not notice Jetavie arriving.

Title: Mirror World
EventDesc: Jetavie says hi to the girl, but the girl ignores her at first. After a while, the girl finally asks her why she is here. Learning that Jetavie has fallen into a mirror, the girl asks if Jetavie wants to learn how to play chess. Jetavie will have to pay the tuition fee, however.

Title: Mirror World
RoleContent: I've never seen someone improve this fast...
EventDesc: Jetavie accepts the girl's guidance. In the beginning, she is quickly defeated by her mentor, but soon her skills improve drastically. After the white-haired girl loses three games in a row, the lessons are over. She believes that Jetavie has become a chess grandmaster.

Title: Mirror World
EventDesc: Jetavie rejects the girl's offer—she has never been particularly interested in chess and games like that. Still, she chats with the girl for a while, and the girl takes a great interest in Jetavie's pupils. She thinks that Jetavie looks kind of like her, so she gives Jetavie some gifts.

Title: Mirror World
EventDesc: Jetavie asks the girl where the exit of this world is. The girl picks up a prism from among all the data crystals on the floor before snapping her finger and sending Jetavie back.

Title: Mirror World
EventDesc: After Jetavie returns to the original world, the prism in her hands turns into a pile of chips.

Title: Chessboard Redux
EventDesc: Jetavie returns to the group of large chess pieces. The black and white figures seem to be glistening silver under the night sky.

Title: Chessboard Redux
EventDesc: The strange girl still stands on the other side of the chessboard. She shouts at Jetavie, hoping to play a game of chess with her.

Title: Chessboard Redux
RoleContent: A fool is always a fool.
EventDesc: The two take turns moving their pieces, and it does not take long for the girl to tense up. Not giving her opponent any chance to recover, Jetavie quickly checkmates the girl.

Title: Chessboard Redux
EventDesc: The girl takes out a crystal chess piece reluctantly—it is the King, a piece that radiates a special energy.

Title: Chessboard Redux
RoleContent: That was before. Things are different now.
EventDesc: Although the girl still gives out the rewards, she will not stop talking about how Jetavie must have cheated.

Title: Chessboard Redux
RoleContent: It seems the fool has not learned.
EventDesc: The girl seems a little mad, but she becomes much calmer after seeing the weapon in Jetavie's hand. Afterward, Jetavie safely leaves the chessboard while the girl watches from afar.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
EventDesc: While searching for the exit of the factory, Jetavie encounters a large group of hostile enemies. They have not managed to injure her, but a malfunction warning appears on her weapon's holographic display after she defeats them all...

Title: Otherworld Comms I
EventDesc: After scanning her weapon, Jetiva finds out that the restrictor has overloaded too many times in a short duration and shorted out. The operation log also suggests that she should swap it out, but the part is said to come from the Alpha world, a place Jetavie has not heard of before.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
EventDesc: Following the previous trails of the void merchant, Jetavie carefully walks along the twisting and crumbling ground until she encounters a warped figure.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
RoleContent: I do not make bad deals.
EventDesc: Jetavie asks if the merchant has any mysterious parts that come from alternative dimensions, and the void merchant reaches his arm into a void crack and takes out the part she needs. When Jetavie tries to take it, the void merchant suddenly asks for a payment.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
RoleContent: This is only for a VIP.
EventDesc: The mechanical malfunction has been fixed, and the weapon works again. To thank Jetavie for her visit, the void merchant also gifts her a few useful weapon boxes as well.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
RoleContent: It's too expensive. I'll figure something out.
EventDesc: Jetavie does not have a lot of chips with her, so she declines the trade and tries to find another way.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
EventDesc: By analyzing and observing the environmental data nearby, Jetavie finds a time-space singularity—a strange cloud terminal.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
EventDesc: Connecting to the cloud network, Jetavie chooses the Alpha data sector and enters the replacement part she needs. Afterward, the system displays the path to the location, and Jetavie is surprised to find another "Jetavie" there. As if having understood something, she chooses the name out of curiosity.

Title: Otherworld Comms I
EventDesc: After sending the request, Jetavie retrieves some computing chips from the other empty cloud servers.

Title: Otherworld Comms II
RoleContent: So the appearance of your eyes can be changed...
EventDesc: Halfway through your journey with Jetavie, a void crack appears before you, wrapping the surrounding space. A strange cloud terminal emerges in front of you, and Jetavie's pupils react to it instantly. The "X" shapes turn into "?" as she curiously approaches the machine.

Title: Otherworld Comms II
EventDesc: You receive an anonymous letter from the machine that asks for your help in acquiring a weapon part.

Title: Otherworld Comms II
EventDesc: After accepting its request, Jetavie and you follow the system's guide to the weapon factory where the part is. You open the door to find a large number of mechanoids nesting there. The enraged mechanoids charge at you, and you are forced to fight them off.

Title: Otherworld Comms II
EventDesc: After defeating the powerful enemies, you indeed salvage the part mentioned in the order from the mechanoid. Jetavie uploads the part to the cloud terminal, and the system displays a path to the target location. You are both surprised to find another "Jetavie" in the Beta sector, and you seem to have understood something.

Title: Otherworld Comms II
EventDesc: After sending the reply, Jetavie and you retrieve some computing power from the other empty cloud servers.

Title: Otherworld Comms II
EventDesc: You question the legitimacy of the request. Worried that it is a trap set by a powerful enemy, you hesitate briefly before leaving with Jetavie.

Title: Otherworld Comms III
EventDesc: Jetavie has been avoiding unnecessary conflicts while her weapon is down... until the day a void crack appears before her again. A familiar cloud terminal falls from the sky, and a group of monsters from another world follow closely behind.

Title: Otherworld Comms III
EventDesc: Jetavie takes out her weapon and fires at the monsters. Right as she pulls the trigger, she remembers that her weapon is still broken, and without the restrictor, the scorching flame destroys the cloud terminal as well.

Title: Otherworld Comms III
EventDesc: Because she has damaged the cloud terminal, Jetavie has to salvage whatever is available in the remains and try to repair the broken part herself in the future.

Title: Otherworld Comms III
EventDesc: After defeating all the monsters with her bare fists, Jetavie approaches the terminal.

Title: Otherworld Comms III
EventDesc: In the mail interface of the cloud terminal, Jetavie receives the emergency package from "Jetavie" in the Alpha world. There is also a photo of the Chosen One and "Jetavie" together attached to the package, with the words "A little help from us!" written on it.

Title: Otherworld Comms III
EventDesc: After Jetivate installs the new restrictor, the weapon accidentally triggers its hidden power pool. The replaced part turns into an energy accumulator, greatly boosting the weapon's power.

Title: Void Fissure
EventDesc: Jetavie spots a fissure in the void. No sign of a merchant or anyone else.

Title: Void Fissure
EventDesc: The moment she steps inside, her mind and body are hurled into an endless ocean.\nIn a daze, she drifts through the quantum ocean for what feels like an eternity. Suddenly, she sees a strange space filled with red and blue data stretching across the murky waters.

Title: Void Fissure
EventDesc: It's a database in the void, recording an endless stream of bottom-level matrix data.

Title: Void Fissure
EventDesc: Jetavie operates the database's computer, searching for the world's "key variables". After filtering through layers of data, she compiles a unique set of coordinates.

Title: Void Fissure
RoleContent: Unusual access detected. <color=#DC143C>Level 2 Emergency Protocol</color> activated.
EventDesc:
The moment she retrieves the coordinates, red lights fill the room, and piercing alarms erupt.
<color=#DC143C>Warning!</color>
<color=#DC143C><size=36>Warning!!</size></color>
<color=#DC143C><size=40>Warning!!!</size></color>
Blazing red warnings flood her vision. Then a distorted figure appears out of nowhere, accusing her of "unauthorized void data access". It fires a beam of light that ejects her violently from the void.

Title: Void Fissure
EventDesc: By analyzing the database, Jetavie manages to find the command to exit this space.

Title: Void Fissure
EventDesc: Jetavie is deeply uneasy about this fissure in the void. She remembers being attacked by red arrows emerging from it before, and now all she wants is to get as far away as possible...

Title: Collection
EventDesc: Using the coordinates gleaned from the void database, Jetavie tracks down a museum. Inside, she discovers strange machinery she's never seen before, including an odd-looking projector glowing pale blue.

Title: Collection
EventDesc: She tries to turn on the device but realizes it's missing an energy source. While she is busy tinkering, she hears the drip of liquid behind her. Turning around, she notices a black "egg" hanging from the ceiling, and it's beginning to hatch...

Title: Collection
EventDesc: A red beam of light blasts a huge hole in the museum's ceiling. As the dust settles, the black egg remains unscathed. Instead, it emits a piercing screech and hurtles toward Jetavie with blinding speed.

Title: Collection
EventDesc: Jetavie asks the strange black egg what it is, what the projector is, and why it won't power on.\nAt first, the egg says nothing. Then, after a long pause, it mutters, "I am... the Image of the Fool!" and starts attacking Jetavie in a frenzy.

Title: Reverse Observation
EventDesc: Jetavie defeats the deranged Image of the Fool. Just then, the "egg" bursts open, baring a strange blue glowing object inside. The projector behind Jetavie resonates with it, emitting rhythmic pulses of electricity.

Title: Reverse Observation
EventDesc: Jetavie steps forward and reaches into the black egg to retrieve its glowing core: a blue key. She knows this key doesn't belong to this world. Perhaps those "others" on the far side will need it.

Title: Reverse Observation
EventDesc:
Jetavie slides the key into the projector, and it hums to life.
Bright lights flood the space, and she begins to hear loud noises around her. She detects many languages and senses countless animated minds.

Eventually, all the tumult converges into an invitation from the void.
—"Rise from nothingness and observe, before all existence fades away."

Title: Reverse Observation
EventDesc: Jetavie examines the projector's endpoint coordinates—an unknown location within the Alpha world. This key-activated device can open a pathway through the void to the Alpha world, offering a chance to change the matrix's predetermined chain of cause and effect.

Title: Reverse Observation
EventDesc: The tangled web of information overwhelms her. Jetavie decides to rest and organize her findings.

Title: Reverse Observation
EventDesc: Aware of the presence of the Void Watcher, Jetavie grabs the key and projector and hurriedly leaves.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: You and Jetavie notice a void fissure tearing open nearby. You walk carefully toward it.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: Staring at the fissure, you feel an inexplicable force pulling you in.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: You see Beta Jetavie emerge from the fissure. She looks like she has just fought a grueling battle—her clothes are torn. You also notice she is holding a blue key.

Title: Void's End
RoleContent: Take the key and get out of here, Chosen One... and you too, Jetavie! Hurry!
EventDesc: Before you can speak, a terrifying ray of energy hurtles out of the void. Just before it strikes, Beta Jetavie blocks it.\nShe hands you the key, telling you both to leave immediately.\nYou sense a fierce killing intent creeping over from inside the void.

Title: Void's End
RoleContent: <color=#DC143C>Level 1 Emergency Protocol</color> activated. Unauthorized void intruders, eliminate on sight!
EventDesc: You refuse to abandon either Jetavie. Just then, a grotesque figure bursts from the fissure.\nRecognizing the newcomer, Beta Jetavie charges forward to attack. Two blinding beams of light collide in midair. You and your Jetavie can't stand idly by. Drawing your weapons, you leap into the fray.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: The defeated Watcher gathers all its computing power, preparing to detonate the area.\nSensing imminent danger, Beta Jetavie channels her remaining energy into her weapon. In a flash, a high-powered beam obliterates the Watcher before it can self-destruct. As the blinding light fades, she collapses to the ground.

Title: Void's End
RoleContent: The rest... is up to you...
EventDesc: You rush to Beta Jetavie and help her back on her feet. Her body, drained of energy, begins to turn translucent. The <color=#DC143C>matrix</color> is in the process of erasing her as an <color=#DC143C>"anomalous variable".</color> Before disappearing, she grasps the hand of the other Jetavie nearby and gives her the weapon charged with her remaining power.\nAfter bidding you farewell, she vanishes along with the void fissure.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: You approach the Watcher's remains and extract a red <color=#DC143C>key</color> from its exposed chest. The blue and red keys resonate with each other. Instinctively, you feel this dual energy may unlock access to the matrix's center.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: The projector in your pocket reacts to the fissure. After activating its "travel" function, you and Jetavie safely enter the void.

Title: Void's End
RoleContent: <color=#DC143C>Level 1 Emergency Protocol</color> activated. Unauthorized void intruders, eliminate on sight!
EventDesc: You wander through this surreal realm for a while and come upon a twisted figure covered in fresh wounds, as if from a recent fight. Spotting you, it attacks without warning.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: You defeat this Void Watcher and recover a plain-looking seal from it, probably used to stamp envelopes. You don't recall ever finding an envelope or anything like that, but it might come in handy later.

Title: Void's End
RoleContent: Mhm! Call it my sixth sense.
EventDesc: Traveling through the void, you reach a world known as Beta. Everything here seems new. The Jetavie at your side senses a connection to this world and trusts her intuition will guide you to the other Jetavie.

Title: Void's End
EventDesc: To be safe, you take Jetavie's hand and steer clear of the void fissure.

Title: Destined Dawnlight
EventDesc: Your fight against the Void Watcher has drawn the system's attention. The matrix's security protocols activate. Void fissures appear everywhere in the Alpha world, with powerful monsters spilling out from them. You and Jetavie flee into the void, only to stumble upon a strange void database.

Title: Destined Dawnlight
RoleContent: So this is the so-called "computing power of duality"...
EventDesc: You find a special anonymous log in the database. It proposes a theory: combining both worlds' keys forms the credential needed to access the matrix's center, though the user must meet a computing power threshold to enter.

Title: Destined Dawnlight
EventDesc: Jetavie places both keys on the database console. Suddenly, the red and blue keys emit dazzling light before merging into a single dual-colored key. The screen displays: "Central Access Credential."

Title: Destined Dawnlight
EventDesc: Putting away the combined key, you exit the void just before the database powers down.

Title: Final Journey
RoleContent: Chosen One, you are not essential to the endgame.
EventDesc: With the Void Watcher slain, the sky over the matrix is filled with red <color=#DC143C>WARNING</color> signs. Even if you try to hide, the Higher Authority tracks you down quickly and appears before you without warning, just like in every previous reincarnation.

Title: Final Journey
RoleContent: Put simply, your existence stands in the way of her evolution.
EventDesc: Before you can ready yourself for battle, countless void fissures appear in the sky, each teeming with arrows. As you shove Jetavie aside, those crimson arrows impale your chest in unison.\n<color=#DC143C>You knew this was coming...</color>\n<color=#DC143C>But there's still a wish you haven't fulfilled.</color>

Title: Final Journey
RoleContent: Use this chip to unlock your computing power!
EventDesc: You grab Jetavie's hand, sending your remaining computing power into her. At that moment, the <color=#DC143C>red-blue key</color> in her pocket glows and transforms into a dazzling chip, and her chest begins to glow as well.

Title: Final Journey
EventDesc:
Right before your consciousness fades, you see Jetavie insert the key into her chest. Just like before, her appearance changes, looking more like Beta Jetavie.
<color=#DC143C>You collapse, feeling relieved.</color>
<color=#DC143C>Somehow, you feel lighter than ever.</color>
<color=#DC143C>Staring at the sky, you grin emptily and slip into oblivion as Jetavie calls your name.</color>

Title: Final Journey
EventDesc: <color=#DC143C>"Chosen One, you are dead."</color>\nFurious, Jetavie raises her weapon. With full access to the matrix's computing power, she no longer fears the Higher Authority looming above.

Title: Existing Obstacles
RoleContent: I have been waiting for you, young one.
EventDesc: With the Alpha World's projector fully unlocked, the chain of cause and effect in the Beta World has changed. Instead of the Authority of Desire she expected, Jetavie meets Sheriff Robert—someone she once crossed paths with in the abyss, who is also one of the incarnations of the Higher Authority.

Title: Existing Obstacles
RoleContent: I'm not interested in your stories. Just get to the point.
EventDesc: Sheriff Robert takes a deep breath and begins his introduction:\nIn another time and space, he is called Ballard, but here, he is Robert. He fights crime tirelessly and people love him. He has a lovely daughter. He did join a cult once, but now his family is perfectly happy...\nAt that point, Jetavie can't help but interrupt him.

Title: Existing Obstacles
EventDesc:
Robert decides to keep it brief:
He thinks unlocking the projector's hidden feature is immoral, and that any attempt to challenge the Higher Authority is laughable. If anyone can stop Jetavie, it's him.
As an incarnation of the Higher Authority, he must act as a "vigilante" or "mysterious enforcer" to teach Jetavie a lesson. Justice and evil are two sides of the same coin...
Hearing this, Jetavie gets impatient again.

Title: Existing Obstacles
EventDesc: Noting Jetavie's annoyance, the Image of Obsession takes a fighting stance, and the battle is about to begin.

Title: Fate's Invitation
EventDesc: The Image of Obsession collapses in front of Jetavie. She never expected such a tough fight. The sheriff, exhausted, slumps to the ground and pulls an invitation from his coat pocket. It looks ordinary, but Jetavie senses faint computing energy flowing through it.

Title: Fate's Invitation
RoleContent: This is just another scam, isn't it?
EventDesc: "It's an invitation from the Higher Authority, a sign of courage, supreme honor, and... the only pass to the center." Hearing the word "center", Jetavie remains composed this time, opting for caution over excitement.

Title: Fate's Invitation
EventDesc: The Image of Obsession shows a faint smile, not bothering to convince Jetavie. He knows that despite her doubts, she will go eventually.

Title: Fate's Invitation
EventDesc: The tough fight from earlier has left her exhausted, so she decides to rest for a bit.

Title: Fate's Invitation
EventDesc: To verify the authenticity of the invitation, Jetavie decides to set out immediately.

Title: Central Gate
EventDesc: Jetavie arrives at the coordinates marked on the invitation and sees a door far more humble than she imagined. Sitting in front of it is a towering mechanoid—so gigantic that its shadow alone engulfs her completely.

Title: Central Gate
RoleContent: You must have a death wish coming here alone!
EventDesc: The mechanical giant rises, shaking the ground beneath it. Introducing himself as "The Emperor" or the <color=#DC143C>"The Image of the Sovereign"</color>, he declares his role as the guardian of the matrix's center. He asks if Jetavie brought what he demands; without it, she will not pass.

Title: Central Gate
RoleContent: We made it just in time!
EventDesc: "She's not alone, she's got us!" calls out a girl's voice behind Jetavie. Turning around, she sees two Alpha allies who arrived unnoticed. The twin-tailed girl waves the seal in her hand. Jetavie nods, taking out a white invitation.

Title: Central Gate
RoleContent: A trio, huh? Makes no difference.
EventDesc: Jetavie hands over the sealed invitation. The gate keeper nods approvingly and retrieves an enormous weapon from behind his back. A battle is imminent.

Title: Central Gate
RoleContent: No stamp? This could be a fake for all I know.
EventDesc: Jetavie hands over the invitation, but the gate keeper sneers, tossing it aside. He demands she prove the letter's authenticity. Jetavie is speechless. At that moment, the gate keeper summons a colossal void fissure and, before she can react, hurls her into its depths.

Title: Central Gate
RoleContent: This is your test for me?
EventDesc: Jetavie attempts to bribe the gate keeper with gold, but he remains unmoved. In her moment of distraction, the gate keeper summons a colossal void fissure and hurls her into its depths.

Title: Central Gate
RoleContent: Long time no see, Jetavie. Have you grown any wiser?
EventDesc: After passing through the void fissure, Jetavie finds herself in an unknown realm. Before she can take a good look at her surroundings, a familiar figure appears before her.

Title: Core Forbidden Zone
EventDesc: Jetavie defeats the powerful gate keeper, but the victory comes at a heavy price—she loses her two Alpha companions. After absorbing their computing power, she is flooded with memories of Alpha Jetavie and the Chosen One. She begins to understand everything that happened in Alpha, but... there's no time to mourn.

Title: Core Forbidden Zone
RoleContent: This time, it has to work!
EventDesc: Once again, Jetavie takes out the invitation, which morphs into a key in her hand. She inserts the key into the <color=#DC143C>Central Gate</color>, opening it.

Title: Core Forbidden Zone
RoleContent: The tower is spinning like crazy...
EventDesc: It's a spiraling world built from dual-colored void crystals and a white tower. Strange lights flicker at the tower's peak. This is definitely somewhere in the void, where sky and ground alike are covered with flowing code. Rather than a <color=#DC143C>calm plateau</color> like the quantum ocean, it looks more like the data core at the bottom level, also known as the <color=#DC143C>"brain zone"</color>.

Title: Core Forbidden Zone
EventDesc: Stepping inside, Jetavie is greeted by a spiraling staircase that twists upward amid flickering illusions. The Higher Authority's voice reaches her ears:\n<color=#DC143C>"Ascend, and you shall learn the whole truth."</color>

Title: Truth Journey
EventDesc: Ascending the spiral staircase, Jetavie reaches the top to find a familiar figure waiting: the Higher Authority stands on a white platform, like a predator waiting silently for prey. Behind her is a <color=#DC143C>rectangular cube</color> made of countless streams of data.

Title: Truth Journey
EventDesc: Computing power flows out of the cube, some of it going to the Higher Authority, some to Jetavie. Jetavie feels her capacity for computation swelling like a tide. This time, the matrix acknowledges her will to fight.

Title: Truth Journey
RoleContent: The truth is right here. Defeat me and you'll see it for yourself.
EventDesc: Jetavie asks the Higher Authority why she was summoned here, why they must fight, and whether everything up to now was part of her plan.

Title: Truth Journey
EventDesc: Ahead lies the Path of Eden, the matrix's final trial. If you're ready, go.

Title: Final Lesson
RoleContent: So this... is the center at full power?
EventDesc: Jetavie cuts her Path of Eden journey short and finds the Higher Authority waiting. This time, she looks different, and Jetavie can sense she won't be holding back. The sheer strength of her aura is unlike anything Jetavie has ever felt before, overwhelming her to the core.

Title: Final Lesson
RoleContent: Jetavie, let us witness this together.
EventDesc: The Higher Authority smiles, telling Jetavie that whatever bad blood they have can be settled right here, right now.\nShe believes two beings near the <color=#DC143C>critical state</color> will catalyze each other's evolution, and whoever prevails will ascend to a higher form. This is the final battle, and the last lesson.

Title: Final Lesson
EventDesc: Jetavie has completed every trial on the Path of Eden, earning the blessings of every mentor along the way. Now, she stands at the journey's end, ready to face the Higher Authority in its ultimate form.\nShe has mastered every combat technique and strategy there is. More than that, she is able to evolve and adapt mid-battle without relying on her computing power—a feat even the Higher Authority may not match.

Title: Final Lesson
RoleContent: Jetavie, let us witness this together.
EventDesc: The Higher Authority smiles, telling Jetavie that whatever bad blood they have can be settled right here, right now.\nShe believes two beings near the <color=#DC143C>critical state</color> will catalyze each other's evolution, and whoever prevails will ascend to a higher form. This is the final battle, and the last lesson.

Title: Quit the Trial
EventDesc: Completing the Path of Eden might grant blessings from old enemies, but Jetavie doesn't waste time with sentimentalities. For all she knows, this could be another snare set by the Higher Authority. Besides, she doesn't need the goodwill of enemies to prove her worth.

Title: Wisdom Palace
EventDesc: Standing before Jetavie is the Image of Wisdom. At his side rests a massive, pitch-black weapon—a hybrid of cannon and greatsword. Curious, Jetavie asks what it is. With a smile, the Image of Wisdom tosses the weapon to her.

Title: Wisdom Palace
EventDesc: Jetavie lifts the weapon and runs her hand over the hilt, sensing its immense power. After she equips it, the Image of Wisdom also stands up, and together they walk slowly toward the battlefield.

Title: Tactics Palace
EventDesc: Jetavie arrives at a prison, where the towering Image of Power gazes at her from behind the bars. Curious, she asks why the image is imprisoned. With a chuckle, the image replies, "How do you know I'm the one imprisoned—and not you"?

Title: Tactics Palace
RoleContent: We have no right to transcend death.
EventDesc: Jetavie opens the cell and is stunned to find a massive arena beyond the bars. As she hesitates, the iron gate slams shut behind her. Realizing a brutal fight is unavoidable, Jetavie readies herself for battle.

Title: Power Palace
RoleContent: It's been a while. You feel different.
EventDesc: In the Power Palace, Jetavie meets the Image of Strength once more. This time, the image seems different—less intimidating, less aggressive. Observing closely, she realizes that even this mighty being hasn't escaped the toll of time.

Title: Power Palace
RoleContent: This time, I'll show you what true power looks like.
EventDesc: When Jetavie explains her purpose, the Image of Strength laughs, regaining his former ferocity and towering size. Standing tall, he tells her that to master strength, she must first learn how to endure the enemy's blows.

Title: Desire Palace
EventDesc: Hearing the snap of an umbrella opening behind her, Jetavie sighs. "Hey, cutie!", a voice calls out as the Image of Desire strolls up casually.

Title: Desire Palace
EventDesc: The Image of Desire smiles and says she has waited a long time to share the secret of true pleasure with Jetavie. The ultimate pleasure, she claims, can only be found in the ultimate battle. Through combat, they will taste both the downfall and the salvation of Bacchus's revelry.

Title: Fondness Palace
EventDesc: A pink-haired Lily intercepts Jetavie midway, planting a kiss on her cheek without warning. Jetavie strikes back on instinct, but Lily evades effortlessly. They face off until Lily stabs her weapon into the ground. A subtle tension builds between them.

Title: Fondness Palace
RoleContent: Till death do us part... can you handle that?
EventDesc: Lily says that kiss was a "kiss of death", a gesture of love, possession, and a final farewell. If Jetavie wants to know the depths of rapture and sorrow, she must defeat Lily in combat.

Title: Ambition Palace
EventDesc: A familiar dark figure blocks the road—a ragged cloak concealing a mechanical arm. Jetavie quickly recognizes the Image of Arrogance. Before she can ready herself, the image lunges at an almost invisible speed. Sparks fly. Moments later, Jetavie stands unscathed, her gun raised.

Title: Ambition Palace
RoleContent: Let me show you how to handle a weapon.
EventDesc: The Image of Arrogance acknowledges Jetavie's quick reflexes but points out the flaws in her weapon handling. Even when wielding two weapons at once, one must prioritize their targets properly based on the distance.

Title: Obsession Palace
EventDesc: The Image of Obsession blocks Jetavie's way. It seems like he has something to say. She tells him to get to the point, but he is displeased by her attitude. They are locked in a standoff until he proposes a one-on-one duel.

Title: Obsession Palace
RoleContent: Reasons? There are plenty, but they don't matter now. There's no turning back.
EventDesc: The Image of Obsession takes a deep breath and assumes a fighting stance, declaring that he will launch a frontal attack. Then, out of the blue, he asks Jetavie why she fights, warning that aimless killing will only make her weak.

Title: Extreme Palace
RoleContent: I shall claim the final glory.
EventDesc: Jetavie reaches the end of Path of Eden, where that same towering figure waits. The Image of the Sovereign draws his weapon from the ground. Clearly, he has been waiting for this moment. He declares himself the final test of her computing power.

Title: Extreme Palace
RoleContent: Stop with the dramatics. Let's do this.
EventDesc: The Image of the Sovereign praises Jetavie's bravery but warns that defeating him will require every technique she has ever mastered. Without giving it her all, no matter how fast her adaptation is, it won't be enough to make the split-second decisions required to defeat him.

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: Beneath a pile of wreckage, Jetavie discovers an ancient scroll preserved in digital form.

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: "Matrix training follows a layered screening process. Those who qualify flawlessly are hailed as the Chosen. Those inferior are deemed as brilliant madmen."\n"Below them are the defective, ordinary individuals who carry a gene capable of turning them into ogres. And even lower than that... pure abominations."

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: "Visitor, do you have a better grasp of what's going on here? For example... which category do you think those two uncontrollable children belonged to?"

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: It appears you still don't understand the rules. Put down this scroll and leave.

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: It appears you still don't understand the rules. Put down this scroll and leave.

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: "Correct. You're clearly competent. Next question: Which category do you believe the pink-haired Lily falls under?"

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: It appears you still don't understand the rules. Put down this scroll and leave.

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: "Right again, quite impressive. Now, here's another question: which category does the Higher Authority belong to? Haha, don't mind the joke. You've passed the test. Take your prize."

Title: Abandoned Scroll
EventDesc: It appears you still don't understand the rules. Put down this scroll and leave.

Title: Abandoned Castle
EventDesc: Jetavie arrives at a ruined castle perched on a cliff. The battle scars outside suggest someone once lived here, yet the gate is locked tight.

Title: Abandoned Castle
EventDesc: There is a square slot on the gate. Placing the right item in it might open the gate.

Title: Abandoned Castle
EventDesc: By some stroke of luck, Jetavie manages to open the gate, and ahead lies a shabby old manor full of expired emergency rations. Climbing upstairs, she finds a bare-bones room.

Title: Abandoned Castle
EventDesc: On the desk lies half of a torn photo featuring a pink-haired woman and someone else. The missing half is nowhere to be seen.

Title: Abandoned Castle
EventDesc: Underneath the photo, Jetavie finds an old compass.

Title: Abandoned Castle
EventDesc: Unable to progress further, Jetavie salvages a few parts from a broken mechanoid outside, then leaves in a hurry.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: Jetavie enters a deserted graveyard with a single tombstone standing alone. A fresh bouquet of flowers rests at its base.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
RoleContent: Is this my grave... or the previous...?
EventDesc: Jetavie examines the tombstone closely and notices the inscription: "In memory of Jetavie". Below it, the signature reads "The Chosen One".

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: Jetavie lifts the bouquet and finds a key tucked among the petals. Though puzzled, she takes it anyway and uses it to open a nearby cabin where she replenishes her supplies.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: While tidying the graveyard, Jetavie kneels down and notices a photo stuck on the tombstone.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: It's half a photo, showing a girl with silver-and-black twin-tails who looks exactly like Jetavie.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: Jetavie pockets this torn photo, wondering where the other half could be. After a quick resupply, she leaves the abandoned graveyard.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: Jetavie takes out the half she found earlier and puts both pieces together. The picture is complete: it shows her standing side by side with an enemy, both smiling brightly, almost like sisters.

Title: Abandoned Graveyard
EventDesc: On the back of the pieced-together photo, a full set of coordinates is scrawled. Following the compass's guidance, Jetavie discovers a strange item nearby.
